body: Empty
We have sparkleshare:// links behind an HTTP basic auth (required mostly to extract users' usernames, to add to the invite xml).

Proof-of-concept implementation (Linux only, also terrible and odious):

    --- sparkleshare-1.1.0/SparkleShare/Linux/sparkleshare.in	2013-08-07 18:39:42.079097101 +0100
    +++ /usr/bin/sparkleshare	2013-07-30 19:17:11.000000000 +0100
    @@ -63,8 +63,33 @@
         ;;
       open|--open)
         invite=`date -u +%N`
    -    open=`echo $2 | sed s/sparkleshare:\/\/addProject//`
    -    curl --insecure --output ~/SparkleShare/$invite.xml $open
    +    open=`echo $2 | sed 's/sparkleshare:\/\/addProject\///'`
    +    returncode=`curl --silent --output /dev/null --insecure --write-out "%{http_code}\n" $open`
    +    case $returncode in
    +      401)
    +        ssuser=`zenity --title="add Invite to SparkleShare" \
    +                       --separator=" password " \
    +                       --text="Password-protected Invite" \
    +                       --forms \
    +                       --add-entry="username" \
    +                       --add-password="Password"`
    +        machine=`echo $open | cut -d'/' -f3`
    +        netrc="machine $machine login $ssuser"
    +        echo $netrc > ~/SparkleShare/$invite.netrc
    +        curl --netrc-file ~/SparkleShare/$invite.netrc \
    +             --insecure --output ~/SparkleShare/$invite.xml $open
    +        rm -f ~/SparkleShare/$invite.netrc
    +        $0 start
    +        ;;
    +      404)
    +        zenity --title="add Invite to SparkleShare" --error \
    +               --text="This SparkleShare Invite could not be -found-"
    +        ;;
    +      *)
    +        curl --insecure --output ~/SparkleShare/$invite.xml $open
    +        $0 start
    +        ;;
    +    esac
         ;;
       *)
         mono "/usr/lib/sparkleshare/SparkleShare.exe" --help

title: brew install macvim --env-std --override-system-vim fails
body: Running on latest Homebrew, Mac OSX Mountain Lion, installed latest Python & Python 3 via brew.
I followed [these instructions] (http://superuser.com/questions/461845/how-can-i-use-the-homebrew-python-with-homebrew-macvim-on-mountain-lion) to symlink my Python 3.

During the step that requires me to install MacVim, I get this error:

```bash
==> Downloading https://github.com/b4winckler/macvim/archive/snapshot-66.tar.gz
Already downloaded: /Library/Caches/Homebrew/macvim-7.3-66.tar.gz
==> ./configure --with-features=huge --enable-multibyte --with-macarchs=x86_64 --enable-perlinterp --enable-rubyinterp --enable-tclinterp --w
==> make  getenvy
==> make 
     ^
9 errors generated.

make [1]: *** [objects/if_python.o] Error 1
make [1]: *** Waiting for unfinished jobs....
make : *** [first] Error 2
```
Never, ever change the Python links that live in `/System` (or ever `sudo` around any system files.)
I would suggest taking the issue up with the posters on that thread, we can't provide support for this case.

I just pushed a fix so that MacVim builds with a brewed Python (if you have one) and successfully load the powerline (I installed it after my brewed python via `pip install pip install git+git://github.com/Lokaltog/powerline`.
(M) Don't ever rename things inside of `/System`.
I had to remove the `--with-python3` option from MacVim because it caused that neither 2.x or 3.x python works in vim.
but for powerline and other plugins python 2.x should be fine (enough).
So please restore your `/System` to the original state and `brew update` and `brew rm macvim` and `brew install macvim`
Sorry guys, I totally didn't even know.
I won't do that again!
How do I restore my `/System` to its original state?
You probably renamed the original link to the temporary one.
So remove the newly created link and rename the temporary one back to the original name.
Any idea what the original link would be?

`lrwxr-xr-x  1 root  wheel     3B Jul 25  2012 /System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/Current@ -> 2.7`

From the SO answer, I take that you renamed the original "Current" to "Current-sys", so you can name it back.
The back-naming is also shown in the SO thread.
I actually went ahead and re-installed the OS.

The install for Vim now went through, but I get this error when launching: 

```bash
An error occurred while importing the Powerline package.
This could be caused by an invalid sys.path setting, or by an incompatible Python version (Powerline requires Python 2.6+ or 3.2+ to work).
Please consult the troubleshooting section in the documentation for possible solutions.

```

brew doctor also is reading as follows:

```bash
➜  ~  brew doctor
Warning: "config" scripts exist outside your system or Homebrew directories.

`./configure` scripts often look for *-config scripts to determine if
software packages are installed, and what additional flags to use when
compiling and linking.

Having additional scripts in your path can confuse software installed via
Homebrew if the config script overrides a system or Homebrew provided
script of the same name.

We -found- the following "config" scripts:

    /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.3/bin/python3-config
    /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.3/bin/python3.3-config
    /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.3/bin/python3.3m-config
    /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/bin/python-config
    /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/bin/python2-config
    /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/bin/python2.7-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/curl-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/freetype-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/libmcrypt-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/libpng-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/libpng15-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/sablot-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/xml2-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/xslt-config
    /Applications/MAMP/Library/bin/yaz-config
    /Applications/MAMP/bin/php/php5.3.14/bin/php-config
```

I'm aware of MAMP, but Python is still giving me trouble.
Ah, nevermind!
I -found- out that the `Python.framework` stuff was in my Path from having previous installed Python from the installer, insteadof with Brew.
I've fixed accordingly, and now I just need to get Powerline working.
This issue is solved!
I can feel my programming competence growing by the second!
Thanks for your help.
Okay, cool.
These `*-config` scripts will eventually break brew builds because most software just looks into the PATH and will try to use them.
This is at least true for `--env=std` (and some formulae still default to std-env), superenv sets the PATH internally during the build.

title: increase .Net client DefaultConnectionLimit
body: currently in .Net client it uses ServicePointManager.DefaultConnectionLimit default value which is 2.
When .Net client app creates 2 connections with SSE or longPolling transport, the 2 connections can't send message.
probably set DefaultConnectionLimit = 20 by default in .Net client?
Moving to post RTW
Don't need to do this anymore since we've resolved the request queuing problem.

title: Global Channel ID map can leak
body: If a user creates a new channel and then deregisters it before closing it, the ID of the channel will never be reclaimed from the global ID map, because there's no way for Netty to know when the underlying JDK channel is really closed.
I can think of the two ways to fix this issue.
(M) * Remove `Channel.id()`.
A user gets the ID via `hashCode()` insteadbecause it's not collision-free anymore.
(M) Keep the ID internally and continue including it as a part of the string representation of a Channel.
Because there is very low chance of ID collision already, it will still be useful to find a specific Channel from a log file.
* add `AbstractChannel.removeId()` so that a user can remove the ID from the global ID map manually.
I prefer the first solution in spite of the backward compatibility problem.
If a user was using Channel IDs as a key or a value of a map or a collection, he or she will have to use the Channel references instead.
The second solution is error-prone at best and thus it just isn't worth it in my opinion.

Let us use the first solution

Am 07.07.2013 um 14:09 schrieb Trustin Lee <notifications@github.com>:

> If a user creates a new channel and then deregisters it before closing it, the ID of the channel will never be reclaimed from the global ID map, because there's no way for Netty to know when the underlying JDK channel is really closed.

> 
> I can think of the two ways to fix this issue.

> 
> Remove Channel.id().
A user gets the ID via hashCode() insteadbecause it's not collision-free anymore.
Keep the ID internally and continue including it as a part of the string representation of a Channel.
Because there is very low chance of ID collision already, it will still be useful to find a specific Channel from a log file.
> add AbstractChannel.removeId() so that a user can remove the ID from the global ID map manually.
> I prefer the first solution in spite of the backward compatibility problem.
If a user was using Channel IDs as a key or a value of a map or a collection, he or she will have to use the Channel references instead.

> 
> The second solution is error-prone at best and thus it just isn't worth it in my opinion.

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
How about just warp the Channel.id() with hashCode() and don't remove it;

I think we should remove id() as it is not a "real" id anymore…

Am 07.07.2013 um 14:39 schrieb kerr <notifications@github.com>:

> How about just warp the Channel.id() with hashCode() and don't remove it;
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
May I ask a question?
In my code, and maybe in other from other users, I used this id to track a specific channel id for particular use (Netty 3.X).
Specifically, I used this to multiplex several logical channels (in memory channels with independent tasks) within one network channel.
If the ID is no more unique, especially for in Memory, all code like this one could be in trouble.

Of course, it is easy to fix this by assigning a specific "internal" id from the code itself, and therefore not relying on the one provide by Netty, but I feel like having an ID for one channel is a good thing, as we have socket id (or so).
I understand the initial issue, but why a user would be able to deregister a channel before closing it at first?
Maybe a dumb question?
Edit and add: also I can imagine a case where the underlying channel is closed or an exception occurs and then, before I was using the id to get back the context.
Now without this id, how can I find out the context related to this event without the id ?
Only the "equality" ?
If the hash is not 100% collision free, then how we do this without any "unique" id ?
@trustin should I take care ?
@fredericBregier can you explain this more..
I don't get your last comment
I'm out of office so excuse the form...

In my last example, taken from my own experience, when you have a lot of channels, mixing network and in memory channels, when you get an exception, sometimes very lately (from business code perspective), the channel id was the only way to know from which context this exception comes from.
Without id, it might be still possible, but the unique id was a good way to make  things easier.
Behind the scene, of course, code relies on hashmap or entries in database using this id as primary key...
however I do not say to not remove id, but if you can keep something close to it, that could help...
@fredericBregier you can use hashCode() which is not 100 % unique.
fixed by 9c1b31d

title: Too many Files open when running large test suite
body:
On a mac, when I run a test suite with 267 tests, I get the following error:

PHP Warning:  require_once(/path_info_here/PEAR/PEAR/PHPUnit/Util/Filter.php): failed to open stream: Too many open files in /path_info_here/PEAR/PEAR/PHPUnit/Autoload.php on line 56

I am running phpunit 3.5.11

here is what the config file looks like:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>

  <phpunit backupGlobals="false"
      backupStaticAttributes="false"
      colors="true"
      convertErrorsToExceptions="true"
      convertNoticesToExceptions="true"
      convertWarningsToExceptions="true"
      processIsolation="false"
      stopOnFailure="true"
      syntaxcheck="false"
      bootstrap="autoload.php"
      >
      <php>
          <var name="exercise-testing" value="true" />
      </php>
      <testsuites>
          <testsuite name="Exercise test Suite">
              <directory>../src/Application/*/tests</directory>
              <directory>../src/Bundle/*/tests</directory>
              <directory>../src/Bundle/ExerciseCom/*/tests</directory>
          </testsuite>
      </testsuites>
    </phpunit>
Not a PHPUnit issue.
just configure your OS' open files limit.
This did not happen before I upgrade to 3.5.11 on the same test suite with more tests, so either something is not closing files like it used to, or there is a bugsomewhere.
Also, I set the file open limit to 100,000 and still get this error.
Have you tried using `lsof` to see what's going on?
(M) Remember that open sockets, streams, libraries, directories, etc, all contribute to your file limit.
So, I ran the test suite, and noticed that after the first Fail, I start getting a ton of pointers to the test.log file.

php         978 xxx   68w     REG       14,2    227130 20970618 /path/to/logs/logs/test.log

This number started to shoot up, past 200 before it died.
Which logfile is that?
Ah, its the log file of the framework we are using.
I'll dig in and see if disabling logging fixes the issue.

title: Media Queries Issue
body: I'm having an issue with media queries using -found-ation 4.
Basically, my code is firing when the screen resolution is 687px and not at 768px (as set by -found-ation 4 in SASS).
What app are you using to test responsive design?
It may be noting that you need to check the window height as well as window width.
Go to window width "480px" and then shrink the window height and it should fire correctly.
just to add, this was an error on my part and I apologise for creating an Issue.
What had happened was at some point in the day I had pressed CMD and - to make  my screen smaller by mistake.
I was then assuming everything was normal.
It took me a good 5+ hours to figure this out.
Sorry for not responding sooner.

title: improve gfm autocomplete
body:
Hi, I'm the project owner of `jquery-atwho-rails` ( [At.js](https://github.com/ichord/At.js) )
I have -found- that gfm autcomplete in gitlab's demo site was very slow.
It's posting Ajax request every times while At.js catch the username.
I have read all issues related to it, and -found- it's my bad that this plugin is not good enough.
And it seems no one want to tell me about it.
so i gonna to do it on my own.

here is the improvement:

* autocomplete **issues**
* **preload** all data ( emojis, issues, members) when inputor (textarea, input) **on focus**.

* can search by issues's `title` and `id`
* can search by member's `username` and `name`
* show popup while preceding by space or is new line.

#3786

One more thing, welcome any suggestions.
Thanks.

:smiley: 

### commits log

* update jquery-atwho-rails to v0.3.0
* autocomplete issues and preload the data.

* add autocomplete_source action to project for gfm autocomplete
* move init_autocomplete layout from head_panel to project_resource

title: support for upgrading an existing extension in a project
body: Something like `compass upgrade foo` maybe?
Can't you just `compass init foo --force`?
We're experiencing a similar issue and I'm not sure if its lack of knowledge or that it isn't possible.
here's an example: Let's say someone creates a project using zurb--found-ation extension and we do some upgrades to the a javascript file or even to the _settings.scss folder.
If they want to latest and greatest they would run `compass create -r zurb--found-ation --using -found-ation` but that won't actually overwrite anything.
If they add `--force` to the end then it overrides, but deletes content they may have changed already or added.
Is there a way to upgrade and only add things that are different or new without overriding things that might have been changed by the user?
@zurbchris In an existing project you'll want to use `init` insteadof `create`.
We could add a feature where files to be added that conflict with existing files, would just add a renamed version alongside the existing one.
this would be a new feature though.
I tried init and it didn't do what I was expecting.
We -found- a good solution though by creating a pattern within the extension that only contains the JS and image files.
If people already have a -found-ation project going they can just run create and pull down that pattern, which will overwrite only the JS/images.
Thanks for the quick response!
I like that approach for now.

title: Redact v8 from core
body:
see: #22572

V8 updates very often, and frequently breaks downstream consumers that don't peg themselves to a known good version.
We've previously removed things that depend on V8 from Homebrew-core.
Things like Node and ArrangoDB that use V8 package their own known versions.
suggest we remove V8 from core and blacklist, but carry it in the head-only repo (since people will keep asking for it back probably.)
I don't feel good about removing things just because our relentless march forward on versions make s them unstable.
I'd rather just not update it as often.
I'm with Jack here.
Ok.

title: allow horizontal scrolling when necessary
body: We have very long URLs so whenever the profiler information pops up it is off to the right and can't be seen unless horizontal scrolling is allowed .
oops ...
I left this a real long time, are we sure there are no ui side effects here?
We've been running a version with this change for a while and AFAIK this CSS change only affects that one window by adding scroll bars to the DIV.

title: duplicated error message when creating user with invalid email
body:
## Summary
When creating a new user with an invalid email, the error message is shown **twice**.

## Steps to reproduce
1.

create a new user
2.

Enter the invalid email `max.test@tester`
3.

Save user

## Expected behavior 
* There is an error message that the email is invalid

## Observed behavior
* There are **two** messages that the email is invalid
!

Running on 5.3 stable 148eade

I'm thinking the error is maybe coming from [this line in orm_adapter](https://github.com/ianwhite/orm_adapter/blob/master/lib/orm_adapter/adapters/active_record.rb#L23) which could call `order` will no params unless an order is passed into it?
Maybe?

This is a really barebones app, so I'm not sure how I've broken it :)
@iHiD you are correct.
if this is causing an issue, it should be solved in ORM Adapter, as first was supposed to be handled transparently by the adapter.
@josevalim OK - cool.
I'll check that out tomorrow and work a PR.
Any ideas why I'm seeing it but presumably everyone else isn't?
Thanks :)
@iHiD remove [this](https://github.com/iHiD/silicon-canal/blob/ac78c31e218b0d70cc081fb193e9e57fe12bb822/lib/string.rb) String extension and everything should work fine.
since this code adds `to_a` method splat operator (*) starts to work incorrectly https://github.com/rubyspec/rubyspec/blob/master/language/splat_spec.rb#L51
Thanks @nashby.
(M) For anyone else coming to this, Vasiliy has written a [great blog post](http://brainspec.com/blog/2013/08/09/make -love-not-ruby-core-extensions/) about this.
@iHiD :heart:

title: Help adding pinch zoom to css3d_youtube demo - trackball controls messing up camera position
body:
Hi,

I'm trying to 'sell' my boss on using three.js to create a CSS3D interface integrated with video providers (like YouTube).
One of the requirements is showing it on a mobile device - I've chosen an iPad since the Android tablet is quirky.

since my demo is scheduled for this Thursday I thought I could show him the wonderful css3d_youtube demo:
https://raw.github.com/mrdoob/three.js/master/examples/css3d_youtube.html.
I also needed to add a few things like a background image and the ability to have the YouTube player go fullscreen.
The problem is it is not configured to use gestures (touch pinch zoom) and I'm having a hard time doing this.
I saw the periodic table is so I decided to use the TrackBall controller.

View code here:
https://bitbucket.org/attlabs/att_html5_uverse_poc/raw/2d6938912839bbcfabdb2c78dfcd204edf05d966/public/javascripts/libs/you_tube_grid.js

but the trackball controller messes up the camera position (view in tablet): http://morning-thicket-1335.herokuapp.com/#/search.
I used the Modernizr library to recognize if the device is touch screen.
If it is I remove the code that is messing up the camera position (you can see where I do this my searching for Modernizr.touch in the code).
This messes up the centering of the camera when you click on the video poster image to the object.

I also tried just regular javascript gesture events by adding this function:

function onPinch(e) {
     move(e.scale)
}

and calling it in an event handler:
document.body.addEventListener('gestureend', onPinch, false)

but that was a disaster.
Can someone help me add pinch zoom functionality to the css3d youtube demo?
It would be MUCH APPRECIATED!
Thanks!
As stated in the [guidelines](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/CONTRIbutING.md), help requests should be done in [stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/three.js).
(M) This board is for bugs or feature requests.

title: body text covers centered background image, how to fix??
body: How and where should I revise the css to have the background image appear properly??
Thank you, Tom
What are you trying to achieve?
Text will always be on top of any background you set on the body.
Do you mean theres a form of highlight on the text?
Almost like the text has a background image?
No highlight on the text.
css background image is supposed to have text appear OVER the image...but this text is as though it's in its own layer...not sure where in the css this is spec'd.

see this for more info:
http://www.tizag.com/cssT/background.php

Thank you, Tom
Does a cursor appear when you mouseover the text?
Send over the code and I'll see if I can help you out.
Doesn't matter if the style is inline within index.html or within a css file.
The mentioned tixag site shows how it "should" work but I want/need to center the image in the browser window.

Code taken from http://css-tricks.com/snippets/css/absolute-center-vertical-horizontal-an-image/

Thank you, Tom

-----Original Message-----
From: Drew [mailto:reply@reply.github.com] 
Sent: Friday, December 09, 2011 2:07 PM
To: Tom Lyczko
Subject: Re: [-found-ation] body text covers centered background image, how to fix??

(#152)

Does a cursor appear when you mouseover the text?
Send over the code and I'll see if I can help you out.

--- 
Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
https://github.com/zurb/-found-ation/issues/152#issuecomment-3084000

Figured it out for a page styled with -found-ation's css -- removing body background color enables showing the image though I don't know what would happen if one needs a different background color than default white.
Thank you, Tom

I -found- and solved this issue -- body cannot have a background color declared if the image is to display centered
Upon commenting out body background-color the centered image displays properly.
Thank you, Tom
Re-declare the body element within app.css, and add your background in there.

use the shorthand property, ie,

```body {background: #333 url('../images/misc/yourbg.png') center center no-repeat;}```

This should override the properties from the -found-ation.css file, works for me!

It wont work if you set it like such:

```body {background-color:#333; background: url('../images/misc/yourbg.png') center center no-repeat;} ``` as the background-color is being parsed first, then the background image, meaning the image is being pushed behind the colour.

Hmmmm...I will try this...though I also discovered that if I declared the positioning in the body element, the image was not vertically centered -- declaring in the html was the only way to get vertical centering.
Perhaps your suggestion would work in the html code though.
Thank you, Tom
Well, check out where the background-color is set in -found-ation.css (on the body) meaning you need to override it on the body element within app.css.
Body by default has a margin and padding, depending on the reset, the HTML element does not, meaning your positioning could be a little off.
(P here's a screenshot: http://fpk.im/elXX
The documentation does not make  it clear at all -- what is the difference between app.css and -found-ation.css??
their purpose and function etc.
Thank you, Tom
app.css is used for your specific website, you shouldn't really be touching -found-ation.css.
If you need to modify some of the rules within -found-ation.css, re-declare them in app.css and modify them in there.
This is essentially because if you start modifying -found-ation.css, it make s it very, very difficult in the future to update your -found-ation files.
Thank you, your comments should be in LARGE GREEN LETTERS on the website.

title: Main.css: `<video>` also `vertical-align: middle;`
body: The `video` tag, being an `inline-block` level element, also suffers from a slight amount of vertical spacing due to `line-height`, just as the `img` tag does.
just wondering if it shouldn't be given the same treatment.
Yup, sound good to me.
Same goes for audio with controls and also canvas if we want to be correct I think.
This is an issue we should discuss in normalize.css.
@necolas, haven't -found- a discussion about it in the normalize repo.
Worth reporting?
This isn't appropriate for normalize because the default is baseline alignment.
I agree with @necolas about the inclusion (or lack thereof) in `normalize.css`, but I think there's definitely precedent for this in `main.css`.
I like the idea of adding `canvas` and `audio` as well.
Are there any more elements that this could also apply to (`object`, `embed`, `svg`), and would it be useful to add those as well?
Yes I agree with @necolas about the normalize.css.
useful to add the media library and j query library
Yea
@joeyhoer Do you want to have a go at putting together a Pull Request for this change to our `main.css` file?

title: dynamic methods of Caller are not always read by Client javascript
body: I have a user initiated method where the user submits an answer for some trivia.
This method is getting called on the MVC 3 side but when it fires off Caller.updateuser(bool)  it only works sporadically.
since I needed a solution that can scale azure role instances, I have the webroles run on a timer interval of 1000ms to push updates to the connected users.
I am not sure if this may interfere with the Caller running methods.

some code:

this runs once a second:  http://pastie.org/3403371

this is the method with the Caller.updateuser() method:  http://pastie.org/3403373

when i watch "var caller"
it always says it completed the request successfully.
Not sure whats going on.
Thanks for any assistance
Scale azure nodes?
SignalR doesn't have a scale out story built in so it won't work on azure without some help.

Take a look at the service bus integration we're working on:

http://blogs.msdn.com/b/clemensv/archive/2012/02/13/signalr-powered-by-service-bus.aspx
For my immediate problem, using the returns on the Hub functions remedied it.
I will be trying out the service bus approach in the near future.
thanks.
Ok, SignalR is one node by default so if you try to use it on multiple nodes it won't work unless you change the message bus implementation.
I am fairly new to using the service bus.
From what I have read; the latest service bus release load balances messages so that they are only read by one instance in a load balanced group.
If this is the case how do you get the services bus to broadcast to all other instances in the group?
Its for this reason I decided to use the cache instead.
however each server node has to manage a timer to update from the cache.
I know this is not the ideal solution but it works for my near real time application.
Cool

title: Not able to detect if the file can be resized or displayed as a thumbnail.
body: I use plupload with a custom UI.
When html5 or flash runtime is initialized it is possible to display a thumbnail.

however, for ie9 with html4 the code which loads image from file.getSource() fails with a javascript error (index out of range) somewhere in the onerror function (I commented out my own onerror handlers).
I wanted to check if the runtime is html4 an don't try to load a thumbnail in this case and display a file name insteadbut didn't find any API for this.
Another concern is that not all images can be resized - as I understand only JPG and PNG.
This means that again, I cannot display a thumbnail for GIF or BMP.
It would be nice to be able to check if the given file can be resized or not.

My temporary solution Includes two things:
1.
(M) I exposed runtimeCan as runtimeCanExt in plupload.Uploader.

since you are building custom UI and probably are using moxie Image wrapper directly, you could simply load the source in it (that's what you have to do to downsize anyway) and listen to `onerror` and `onresize` events on image object.
If the source is compatible image will be resize and `onresize` will be triggered, otherwise - `onerror`.
Are you sure that there's an onresize event?
I -found- there onerror, onload and onembedded.
And, again, what can I do in onerror when the code already failed during loading/resizing image?
I wanted to prevent JS errors that IE will display to the end user.
I am not an experienced JS programmer, but it seems to me that doing check before loading an image in the main codepath is more convenient approach compared to recovering in error handlers.
Especially taking in account the fact that I use GWT wrappers around the JS code.
I didn't double checked, but, as I remember, html4 code failed before onerror event for the image was triggered.
I mean that failed the code that had to trigger onerror event.
@ovkhasch I will check html4.
however having alternative code in `onerror` handler seems pretty much ok in general.
After all, even image has jpg or png extension, it may appear corrupt or not in format it pretends to be in.
No error should propagate to the browser though, if it does, then it's a bug.

Btw if you are looking to have thumbnails across all browsers, even legacy ones, I would suggest removing html4 from runtime list, since while it tries to display thumbs in browsers that support canvas or dataUrl in older browsers it will obviously fail.
Davit, thanks for helping me with this!
I checked that both for html4 and for html5+GIF cases onerror is triggered.
I simply had an invalid handler.
Sorry for the incorrect information.
For IE9+html4 I show an image file name insteadof thumbnail.
The user is able to upload fullsize images in IE9, then these images are scaled on the server side.
The same thing I do for GIF and BMP in html5 case.
So I'd like to keep html4 as a backup for uploading, why not?
The bad thing about onerror is that it doesn't give me any information about what's being wrong.
It can be a corrupt image or simply IE9 scenario or GIF image in html5 case.
If I will use it I won't be able to tell if I should try to upload to server or show an error message to the user.
It would be nice to have several meaningful error codes for different problems.
however, I can always proceed with uploading and check for bad images on the server side - your suggestion about using onerror make s sense!
Ah, yes, now I -found- the resize event and others...
This was my bad knowledge of javascript :(
I'd better leave this issue open as you may want to provide more error details in onerror parameters.
just FUI - I was able to implement my scenario as you suggested using onerror and onload.

title: Reconnect does not work with Chrome/serverSentEvents transport when server disappears/reappears
body: Reproduced this in 1.0.1. and 1.1-beta1.

Steps to repro:

1.
Load a web page in Chrome that establishes a serverSentEvents hub connection.

Shut down the web server
3.

Bring the web server back up

Between step 2 and 3, you will see a reconnect attempt in the console every second or so, but upon restoring the web server, there are no more console traces until the 30 second timeout has elapsed, when it stops trying.
That's by design.
We only retry for about 30 seconds then we raise disconnected client side.
If you want to reconnect infinitely handle reconnecting then you need to restart the connection in the disconnected event.
If you're saying it doesn't retry once the server is started and the connection still isn't established then that's a bugbut it's unclear from your description which one it is.
The server is brought back up well before the 30 seconds are up, and it always fails to reconnect and times out.
@Xiaohongt please try to repro this
I can repro, we should assign to a dev.
It's only trying to reconnect twice in a 10 second period, so it the server goes up after the two retries the client does not attempt a third time.
[15:41:50 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time)] SignalR: Negotiating with '/signalr/negotiate?clientProtocol=1.3'.

jquery.signalR.js:50
[15:41:50 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time)] SignalR: attempting to connect to SSE endpoint
[15:41:58 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time)] SignalR: EventSource reconnecting due to the server connection ending jquery.signalR.js:50
[15:42:00 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time)] SignalR: attempting to connect to SSE endpoint
[15:42:05 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time)] SignalR: attempting to connect to SSE endpoint
[15:42:30 GMT-0700 (Pacific Daylight Time)] SignalR: couldn't reconnect within the configured timeout (30000ms), disconnecting.
jquery.signalR.js:50

Thannks @gustavo-armenta 

@NTaylorMullen can you take a look at this one please.

here is a good repro
iisreset -stop & timeout 15 & iisreset -start
verified that on JS serverSentEvent reconnected when the web site stop about 25 seconds and restart

title: create an Explorer folder icon
body:
i see my link in the favourites bar, but the icon of the folder is a normal one because in the sparkleshare folder there is no desktop.ini (see #624 )
i am missing the link in the autostart folder too and i have a little feature request

would it be possible to add the icon to add/remove programms ?

it is just one line for wix to add:
    `<Icon Id="icon.ico" SourceFile="MySourceFiles\icon.ico"/>`
    `<Property Id="ARPPRODUCTICON" Value="icon.ico" />`

-> http://wix.sourceforge.net/manual-wix3/configure_arp_appearance.htm
The annoying thing here is that we can't just change Windows's icons, as i'm guessing they won't be compatible with the GPL.
We'll need to find some other icons that are similar in style to the Windows 7 folder icons but that we can ship.
so you don't want to replace the folder icon with the existing sparkleshare icon but change icons dynamically like DropBox does ?
When i am right, we should have a look to TurtoiseSvn or TutroiseGit, because they have the same behaviour and are GPL.

I searched through the coude of TurtoiseSvn and -found- a c++ class that modifies the existing icons [IconOverlay.cpp] (https://code.google.com/p/tortoisesvn/source/browse/branches/1.7.x/src/TortoiseShell/IconOverlay.cpp)
Maybe it is possible to change icons with c# too.

Code can be -found- here: 
[TortoiseSvn] (https://code.google.com/p/tortoisesvn/source/browse/)
[TortoiseGit] (https://code.google.com/p/tortoisegit/source/browse/)
Looked into this a bit.
seems like it is hard to do in C# and easier to do in C++.

(M) Following links have examples of how to do this:
- http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/7484/How-to-overlay-an-icon-over-existing-shell-objects
- http://1code.codeplex.com/SourceControl/changeset/view/54422#640342
This is just about the orange sparkleshare folder icon.
(M) The overlay badges are handled by #389.
but thanks for the links!
We somehow need to grab the existing Windows folder icons and change the hue in memory.
or something like that.

Alright then I have two new questions:

- What exactly is the problem regarding GPL?
- Why change the hue?
Can't we just do like this: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/9331/create-Icons-for-Folders-in-Windows-Explorer-Using ?
Sorry for the misunderstanding and my incompetence in the subject
@kozze89 yes, setting the icon to the folder is pretty easy.
The problem is that the folder icons can probably not be relicensed under the GPL, making SparkelShare partly not open source.
I'm not sure how adding this feature (and applying the "fix" the original poster suggested) would threaten the GPL.
If the SparkleShare folder icon is opensource, that should be enough.
@aderouineau it would infringe on MS's copyright for the folder images and, as far as i know, they haven't released those folder images in a GPLv3 compatible manner.
Well, how about an extra utility that offers this behaviour and won't be licensed under GPLv3 but still Open Source?
You might want to recommend using that tool in the installer or on the webpage.
(M) @alexschomb it's not about the GPL in particular, you can pretty much replace "GPL" with "Open Source" in my comment.
Having a separate utility also kind of misses the point of having a nice an integrated application.
Well, too bad.
but isn't it better having a separate utility insteadof nothing?
I disagree...
I'd rather do it properly, but you are free to create such utility of course.

:)
If anyone is able to help doing the in memory manipulation of the Windows folder icon that would be great.

title: pip fails to upgrade distribute and pip
body: Trying to upgrade distribute or pip results in a weird permissions error.

(W)here is the gist:
https://gist.github.com/janrito/35fd541765d0c1145194

In summary, 

    pip --upgrade --no-deps --ignore-installed pip 

or 

    pip --upgrade --no-deps --ignore-installed distribute 

fail by complaining:

    error: /usr/local/bin/pip: Permission denied

and:

    error: /usr/local/bin/easy_install: Permission denied

Permissions are set correctly.
I'm seeing the same error when trying to upgrade distribute.
It sounds like your pip and easy_install binaries aren't `+x`; not sure why that would be though.
`/usr/local/bin/easy_install` is a symlink to `/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/easy_install`, which had mode 444 on my system.
Changing the file mode to 644 on `easy_install` and `easy_install-2.7` allowed the distribute upgrade to finish.
Maybe the python formula has a permissions bug?
The error seems to be that both the links in `/usr/local/bin/` and the actual executables in `/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/` are set to `r_xr_xr_x`, when they should be `rwxr_xr_x` at last.
The bugseems to be in the python formula as @mephaust suggests.

I'm getting the same error:

```
Samorost:~ russ$ pip install --upgrade distribute
[snip]
reading manifest file 'setuptools.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'

reading manifest template 'MANIFEST.in'

writing manifest file 'setuptools.egg-info/SOURCES.txt'

Copying setuptools.egg-info to /usr/local/lib/python2.7/site-packages/setuptools-0.8-py2.7.egg-info

running install_scripts

Installing easy_install script to /usr/local/bin

error: /usr/local/bin/easy_install: Permission denied
```

```
Samorost:bin russ$ ls -l | grep easy
lrwxr-xr-x  1 russ  admin      39  6 Jul 16:54 easy_install -> ../Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/easy_install
lrwxr-xr-x  1 russ  admin      43  6 Jul 16:54 easy_install-2.7 -> ../Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/easy_install-2.7
-rwxr-xr-x  1 russ  admin     352  6 Jul 14:56 easy_install-3.3
lrwxr-xr-x  1 russ  admin      41  6 Jul 14:51 easy_install3 -> ../Cellar/python3/3.3.2/bin/easy_install3
Samorost:bin russ$ cd ../Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/
Samorost:bin russ$ ls -l | grep easy
-r-xr-xr-x  1 russ  admin  422  6 Jul 16:54 easy_install
-r-xr-xr-x  1 russ  admin  430  6 Jul 16:54 easy_install-2.7
```

It seems all the files in ``../Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/`` are symlinks to ``/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7/bin/`` **except** for our problem files ``pip`` and ``easy_install``.
permission denied sounds like you once installed or upgraded with `sudo`.
So either set the right, so you you can write or use `sudo` for upgrading, too.
@samueljohn I can assure you that was not the case, I rm-ed the files and brewed python again, same issue.
This is not a sudo problem.
Notice that the permissions for the files are set to the right user, but they are set to non-writeable by anyone.
I was facing the same issue and changing the permission of the the easy_install file in /usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin fixed the issue.
The formula needs to be fixed.
I am on the latest version on brew.

Quick fix:

    cd /usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin
    chmod u+w easy_install* pip*
I ran into the same problem and @akshetpandey's solution fixed it for me.
+1 @bmonty, just solved the problem for me.
Okay I see.
suggestions?
could that have been a setuptools bug?

They are increasing versions numbers like a spree :-)

Oh btw.
a new pip has been released.
I get the same permission issue, they are clearly incorrect.

From a fresh `brew install python --universal`:

```shell
$ ls -la /usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/ | egrep "pip|easy_install"
-r-xr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   419 Jul 26 10:33 easy_install
-r-xr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   427 Jul 26 10:33 easy_install-2.7
-r-xr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   380 Jul 26 10:33 pip
-r-xr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   388 Jul 26 10:33 pip-2.7
```

As noted, those files are not symlinks into `/usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.7`.
but that is correct I assume.
The suggestions given do work around the issue.
but in my opinion the proper permissions should be set by the installer of setuptools.
Because if setuptools installs non-writable files on a non-brewed Python, it will also give this error since it is a permission issue.
It is not related to Homebrew specifically.
As far as I can see Homebrew only runs the installer on setuptools and pip.
That said, Homebrew works around inconsistencies and failures of packages to just make  things work, so maybe the Python formula should just chmod the files until setuptools fixes it?
Same permissions problems and @akshetpandey's solution also worked for me.
I agree with @michaellopez: if this is a known bugor issue whether with Python itself or not, brew's formula should address it.
Oh man, I wish I had read this bugearlier.

Homebrew sets permissions on everything in `bin` to 0555 during the clean step:

https://github.com/mxcl/homebrew/blob/c88d73c11547c54803e64d2748d23106702a2073/Library/Homebrew/cleaner.rb#L50-L51

It has done this since 43f1c00d085bd441a746a891640f5dd695c290f9, very early in the project, almost four years ago.
The assumption being that these files are not going to be modified.
I was wrong, it was actually two months earlier in 20b84a49630d6df85aa9d4652f4e0e0af9a307d2.
> The assumption being that these files are not going to be modified.
I think this assumptions are correct!

just `pip` and `setuptools` are not
installed like other python packages.
Look at my pull request #21476
@samueljohn is this the issue that prompted 955b8fa58c69b1060b83a383ddb14392bee806be?
I think it can be addressed by `skip_clean 'bin/pip', 'bin/easy_install'` (and the '-2.7' variants and whatever others).
@jacknagel yes it is.
Sure?
Does brew set the rights differently?
The root of the issue is that `pip` thinks it is installed at `$(brew --prefix)/bin/pip` but there is only a symlink not the real thing.
Pip fails to remove that symlink.
The point is that the permissions on symlinks are meaningless.
You can't even `chmod` a symlink (it changes the permissions of the target).
It's the permissions of the target file that matter, and we set permissions on all executables to 0555 by default (as I pointed out a few comments earlier).
If you re-read the thread you'll see that people were able to resolve this issue by fixing the permissions on the real files in the keg.
@jacknagel o.O I must have overlooked your earlier comment.
Excuse me.
There are still parts of the homebrew code base that I don't yet fully understand obviously.
So I am testing to `skip_clean 'bin/pip', 'bin/easy_install'` (and with suffixes).
Apparently skip_clean doesn't opt-out of the setting permissions, which seems like a bugin itself.
(M) If it's not leaving the permissions alone, that's a bug.
Okay after 21bb9912c6654af7fcdb4392c33fe5c68f7a15ad and adding skip_clean for pip and easy_install, I can upgrade them in-place.
How can you fix this issue without reinstall?

This should do it:

```
$ cd $(brew --prefix python)
$ chmod u+w pip* easy_install*
```

I guess it should be:

    cd $(brew --prefix python)/bin
    chmod u+w pip* easy_install*
    cd $(brew --prefix python3)/bin
    chmod u+w pip* easy_install*
Thanks @jacknagel, looks good now.
works for me now.

(M) I did:

```shell
brew update
brew upgrade
brew uninstall python
brew install python --universal
```
Results in:
```
$ ls -la /usr/local/Cellar/python/2.7.5/bin/ | egrep "pip|easy_install"
-rwxr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   334 Aug 29 07:57 easy_install
-rwxr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   342 Aug 29 07:57 easy_install-2.7
-rwxr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   301 Aug 29 07:57 pip
-rwxr-xr-x   1 michael  admin   309 Aug 29 07:57 pip-2.7
```
Permissions are correct now after 3bbb97e.
Great work!
Nice work!

title: added capability to wrap d3 as an AMD module.
body:
To generate a wrapped d3, do:

    $ make  MODULE_TYPE=amd

The wrapped d3 will be -found- in d3-amd.v2.js and d3-amd.v2.min.js.
should this go into the 2.9.8 branch instead?
Thank you for this improvement.
I hope to find it in main d3.js distro soon.
Any update on this?
would it make  more sense to just use the [amdWeb](/umdjs/umd/blob/master/amdWeb.js) pattern from [umdjs](/umdjs)?
That way AMD is used if it's present and browser globals are used if it's not.
+1 on having d3 utilize the amdWeb pattern in the default build.
I'd go further and suggest that d3 itself might benefit from a transition to AMD modules internally (with [r.js](/jrburke/r.js) or similar to build the output file).

check the component user @ github: https://github.com/component  
There is a D3 component created that utilizes the AMD style loading you are asking.
(M) Plus, after loading all your components, creating a single minified file becomes simple to do.

--  
Brandon Myers


On Monday, January 28, 2013 at 12:45 PM, S. Andrew Sheppard wrote:

> +1 on having d3 utilize the amdWeb pattern in the default build.
> I'd go further and suggest that d3 itself might benefit from a transition to AMD modules internally (with r.js (/jrburke/r.js) or similar to build the output file).

>  
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub (https://github.com/mbostock/d3/pull/745#issuecomment-12796976).
Thanks for the link, though it appears that the referenced components (including the D3 component) are based on CommonJS rather than AMD.
As I understand it, a key benefit of AMD over CommonJS is the ability to use & debugindividual module files directly within the browser before building the singled minified file for deployment.
I believe that this system supports just that.
The minified version is the additional benefit (with all dependencies) that this system provides.

--  
Brandon Myers


On Monday, January 28, 2013 at 2:20 PM, S. Andrew Sheppard wrote:

> Thanks for the link, though it appears that the referenced components (including the D3 component) are based on CommonJS rather than AMD.
As I understand it, a key benefit of AMD over CommonJS is the ability to use & debugindividual module files directly within the browser before building the singled minified file for deployment.

>  
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub (https://github.com/mbostock/d3/pull/745#issuecomment-12802171).
To clarify - given its dependency on the CommonJS module syntax, it seems unlikely that Component can automatically load source modules directly into the browser as-is, a key feature of AMD.

AMD was created specifically to address the lack of asynchronous module loading in CommonJS, and thus requires a different module definition syntax (see http://requirejs.org/docs/whyamd.html for more information).
More to the point, since the AMD module format is not directly compatible with CommonJS, Component is not a useful option for those of us who are already using AMD.
FWIW, a number of libraries (jQuery Mobile and Dojo being two prominent examples) have already or are in the process of migrating to AMD.

In order to use d3 in their projects, AMD developers have three main options:
 - use the "shim" capability in RequireJS (http://requirejs.org/docs/api.html#config-shim) - a stopgap measure at best.

- Maintain a custom version of d3 with AMD support added (a couple of lines of code, but still less than ideal)
 - work with the d3 community to add AMD support to the library.
This pull request is just to add it to the final built file, which will be a great start.
I also think there would be a benefit to converting all of the d3 source modules to the AMD format - but let's defer that discussion to a later time.
The [amdWeb](/umdjs/umd/blob/master/amdWeb.js) pattern provides a nice compromise between AMD and the traditional "browser global" approach.
The nice thing is that it should not break any existing functionality.
@gregsymons and others, would you be interested in updating this pull request (or creating a new one) with an amdWeb-based solution?
should this go into the 2.9.8 branch instead?
Thank you for this improvement.
I hope to find it in main d3.js distro soon.
Any update on this?
would it make  more sense to just use the [amdWeb](/umdjs/umd/blob/master/amdWeb.js) pattern from [umdjs](/umdjs)?
That way AMD is used if it's present and browser globals are used if it's not.

title: AssertConfigurationIsValid() fails to ignore { get; private set } properties
body: Instead, it flags this as an unmapped member.
(M) Note: this is somewhat similar to https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/173.
AutoMapper can set property with private setter.
Please check this - https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/blob/master/src/Unittests/CustomMapping.cs   test with name -  should_translate_to_properties_that_have_a_private_setters()

@Khryukin,

I wasn't aware that AutoMapper would attempt to map to destination properties with private setters.
however, I still don't believe AssertConfigurationIsValid() should fail if you don't provide mappings for private setters.

I suggest adding an overload of AssertConfigurationIsValid() with a parameter "IncludePrivateSetters" that allows explicitly setting whether you want AutoMapper to validate properties with private setters.
Eventually, the overload without this parameter could be deprecated.
More broadly, while I'm sure there are legitimate use cases for mapping to properties with private setters, I just don't think this should be default behavior.
Generally, private setters are used for a reason.
shouldn't you have to opt-in to bypassing something as fundamental as encapsulation?

@danthman ,
I think that it depends on the policy of AutoMapper.
Currently *some* people expect from AssertConfigurationIsValid() method that it will check private setters map and *some* not.
I think that it could be useful to add a parameter "IncludePrivateSetters" (I prefer "WithoutPrivateSetters" parameter).
(M) the assert will be more flexible in this case.
@Khryukin, sounds good.

title: truncate with HTML ellipsis character entity
body: *Imported from Lighthouse.

* Original ticket at: http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/1641
created by **Aupajo** - 2011-02-19 09:28:16 UTC

I -found- myself changing the default from project to project, so here's my patch for it.
(M) This sets `truncate`'s default `:omission` from three dots (...) to the "proper" HTML character entity for an ellipsis (`…`).
(M) This will render the ellipsis properly as a single character and is more semantically correct.
I think, in the context where truncate is used, this is nicer.
*Imported from Lighthouse.

*
Comment by **Jeremy Olliver** - 2009-03-08 07:12:32 UTC

I think this sounds like a good idea.

A concern that I'd have before this patch gets applied is that when specifying the total length, of the truncated string, the escape character is counting as an 8 character string "…" rather than the roughly 3 character space it takes up when displayed in the browser.
e.g.

truncate("Hi my name is", :length => 10)
# => "Hi…"

where what might be expected is:
# => "Hi my n…"

I've added a patch to be applied ontop of your patch to show the behavior I expect in the tests.
I'm not quite sure how best to change this behaviour (ie, treat "…" as not taking up the space of 8 characters) yet though
*Imported from Lighthouse.

(M) *
Comment by **Aupajo** - 2009-03-09 03:20:34 UTC

A trade-off might be to increase the default `:length` by 5 characters.
Another solution would be to treat length as the encoded character length, and treat `&etc;` as single characters, thus changing the eight characters of the `…` to one.
*Imported from Lighthouse.

*
Comment by **Rizwan Reza** - 2009-08-08 21:35:52 UTC

not reproducible

-1 The patch doesn't work properly.
+1 The idea isn't bad.
I think using proper HTML characters is always nice.
*Imported from Lighthouse.

*
Comment by **Rizwan Reza** - 2010-03-27 12:55:07 UTC

Please post a patch where … is considered a three character string.
This will be backwards compatible yet supporting correct HTML character.
When making this patch, please make  it against master.
Thanks.
You can assign it to me when done.
I am changing ticket's state to stale.

title: Cannot dump definitions which have method calls.
body:
Hi Fab, and all,

I want to help, but please note that this is a very elusive issue.

I do not have a minimal repro test case, but I will try to elaborate:

========================================================================================
Error message : "Cannot dump definitions which have method calls.".

Stacktrace:
```
PHP Fatal error:  Uncaught exception 'RuntimeException' with message 'Cannot dump definitions which have method calls.'

in /var/www/test_deployment/shared/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Dumper/PhpDumper.php:1018
Stack trace:
#0 /var/www/test_deployment/shared/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Dumper/PhpDumper.php(337): Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\Dumper\PhpDumper->dumpValue(Object(Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\Definition))
#1 /var/www/test_deployment/shared/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Dumper/PhpDumper.php(572): Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\Dumper\PhpDumper->addServiceInstance('serializer', Object(Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\Definition))
#2 /var/www/test_deployment/shared/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Dumper/PhpDumper.php(631): Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\Dumper\PhpDumper->addService('serializer', Object(Symfony\Component\DependencyInjection\Definition))
#3 /var/www/test_deploym in /var/www/test_deployment/shared/vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Dumper/PhpDumper.php on line 1018
```

Faulting service (via php app/console container:debug), this is the value I got from dumping the "$class" in addServiceInstance .

sensio_framework_extra.converter.manager         container Sensio\Bundle\FrameworkExtraBundle\Request\ParamConverter\ParamConverterManager

========================================================================================
Repro steps: NONE

however, I narrowed down the commit to a CONFLICT MERGE which requires manual intervention.

From git diff, there are 4 major places which were affected:
1) a constants file, containing things like class Status { const ACTIVE = 0; } which is not breaking
2) test cases in phpunit, nothing fancy.

3) services.xml, adding 4 new custom services

Apparently, the 3) is the most likely cause because the stacktrace also tells of something in adding a service instance.
however, those were all custom developed instances and with prefixed ids, so would never conflict with the other bundle ones.
Yet, the commit before this faulty commit works.
No more idea on how to work.
A very suspicious bundle is the Sensio bundle, and the class is Sensio\Bundle\FrameworkExtraBundle\Request\ParamConverter\ParamConverterManager .
Temporary fix: Comment out the 'Cannot dump definitions which have method calls.'.
I don't like it, but I have to.

========================================================================================
Environment and code revisions:

```
$php -v
PHP 5.4.0 (cli) (built: Mar 23 2012 15:08:43)
Copyright (c) 1997-2012 The PHP Group
Zend Engine v2.4.0, Copyright (c) 1998-2012 Zend Technologies

$ apachectl -v
Server version: Apache/2.2.22 (Unix)
Server built:   Mar 26 2012 17:54:48

"git log" at /vendor/symfony/src/Symfony/Component/DependencyInjection/Dumper gives:
commit b55a43813e8fbcf4facd19ce1da0cd7acc67ce9b
Author: Fabien Potencier <fabien.potencier@gmail.com>
Date:   Wed Nov 16 20:35:49 2011 +0100

"git log" at /vendor/bundles/Sensio/Bundle/FrameworkExtraBundle/Request/ParamConverter
commit dcd40eb4e2fff2d82fad644bb44fc2a40ccaf381
Merge: 96949b8 338cc31
Author: Fabien Potencier <fabien.potencier@gmail.com>
Date:   Mon Nov 7 08:38:47 2011 +0100
```

========================================================================================

The code change/commit is private resource, such as I cannot divulge information publicly to be indexed.
Developers of the branch may want to ping me.
Thanks.

https://github.com/doctrine/DoctrineBundle/issues/45#issuecomment-6391198
https://github.com/symfony/symfony/issues/4016


but to no avail.
I also never made changes to profiler in the faulty commit, and this issue happens in both dev and prod environment.
We encoutered the same strange behavior.
adding  a new dummy service made the trick to unlock the situation.
(M) Astonishingly, by playing with the number of registered services, you can bypass the error.
Thanks for reply.
Do you mean just adding an empty class and then into the services.xml?

If I remember well, we registered new monolog handlers to fix it quickly:

```
monolog:
    handlers:
        main:
            type:  stream
            path:  %kernel.logs_dir%/%kernel.environment%.log
            level: debug
        firephp:
            type:  firephp
            level: info
        justaddedBecauseOfDefinitionsproblem1: { type: "null", level: info }
        justaddedBecauseOfDefinitionsproblem2: { type: "null", level: info }


```
Also, we didn't have problem after having disabled monolog bundle.
@Seldaek any hints?
Maybe not related at all.
MonologBundle creates services with method calls, but it works just fine for most people so I don't think it's the root cause of the issue.
Well, apparently, each guy reporting the issue fixed it by disabling a different bundle.
And none of them produces a way to reproduce this bug, making it impossible to debugit (AFAIK, none of the core devs ever saw this)
(M) I'm pretty sure it's more related to Container dumper, and not to a specific bundle, indeed :)
@docteurklein sure it is.
but without a reproducible case, we are unable to know why an invalid code is dumped.
We seem to have tracked this down to https://bugs.php.net/bug.php?id=61453 which happens in PHP 5.4.0 Releases.
Upgrading PHP should fix this
@mazen what is the PHP release containing the fix ?
And could you add a warning in the requirements check once you know the broken range (the code is in SensioDistributionBundle) ?
Thanks.
I will definitely check out what caused the issue.

Best Regards
Eric Chio "Log0"

title: overrideMaterial and renderObject() geometry mismatch
body: Hi guys, I posted this on stack overflow, but the general consensus was that it might be worth mentioning it here as well.
I can't figure out how to overcome a potential limitation of the three renderer and was hoping someone might have a good design of how best to overcome the issue.
Say you create a scene with mesh objects and apply a basic material to them.
Because you've created the objects using the basic material, the geometry will never have normals generated for it as the basic material does not need it.
(Along with most of the other attributes).
From what I understand, just before the object is rendered to the screen it calls the initMeshBuffers function.
This essentially creates the array buffers which later get used in the materials and shaders.
The geometry by default has normals.
but inside the initMeshBuffers function the __normalArray variable never gets set.
(W)The reason is because just before it fills them, it looks at the material.
If the material is basic it decides that the __normalArray buffer should not get filled - even if the geometry has normals.
Let's say I now want to render the scene again (for a post process), but this time I use an override material on the renderer.
This override material is a shader material and it does require normals.

When the scene is being rendered, the renderer will apply the override material, however it will throw invalid pointer errors because the new shader requires normal attributes but the mesh geometry does not have any because it was created with a basic material.
So how would I be able to achieve this second render pass?
The first render has to use basic materials as anything more is overkill and could slow down the application.
The second pass must contain normals as its rendering important information for a post process effect.
I can't call needsupdate on the materials or geometry each time as its part of the render loop and having to rebuild them each frame will be hugely expensive.
I guess the one approach would be to not use basic materials at all and insteadcreate my own shader material that uses a very basic program.

Though it seems a bit like reinventing the wheel doing this... 

Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Thanks
As stated in the [guidelines](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/CONTRIbutING.md), help requests should be directed to [stackoverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/three.js).
This board is for bugs and feature requests.
On the other hand, if you feel this is a bug, and can demonstrate it, please see the [guidelines](https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/CONTRIbutING.md) for How to Report a Bug.

title: remove ghost doubles of links on Android browsers
body: The WebKit acceleration call -webkit-transform: translateZ(0) appears to causes "ghost doubles" of links in some Android browsers, which causes links to exists both in their proper locations as well as in a second location offset down from the proper one.
This is annoying.
If these two calls are removed from mobile.scss, everything works properly.
This is a fix for #2123
strange, but ok!

title: Strange display in iceweasel
body:
Hello, 
I try with three differents computers and i always got display problems with iceweasel (empty squares and text in place of icons on the top bar).

I think it could be same problem as in https://github.com/diaspora/diaspora/issues/1013

here is a printscreen : http://uppix.net/8/7/1/189649180408deb84ba6dc1493fc2.jpg
I can also verify this - I'm running Debian Squeeze with Iceweasel 3.5.16 (should be equal to the same Firefox version in the internals), and it appears that it is not rendering inline svg images.
I can, however, navigate directly to the svgs, and they render fine.
To elaborate, there are several graphical artifacts when using Iceweasel 3.5 (and likely FF 3.5 also) with Diaspora.
After some digging, I -found- that the "badges" on the top menu were inline SVG images.
(M) These are definitely not rendering properly.
however, I can navigate directly to the full URL of the SVG, and it renders perfectly well.
I'm wondering if it's a matter of Firefox not supporting something in the html, but can't say for sure, as I don't have much web development experience.
I tried a few things with firebug- manually overriding the image urls to be fully qualified links, stripping the ?XXXX bit from the image URL, all with no success.
There are also some artifacts around several text-entry boxes, but I have no insight on those at this time, and they may be unrelated.

Screenshots of Firefox 5 alongside Iceweasel 3:
http://imgur.com/FdaNpl&l7riK&ckYb1&OgaZl?full
(4 images at that link; Clean images are FF5, images with artifacts are Iceweasel 3)

Screenshots of navigating directly to SVGs in Iceweasel 3:
http://imgur.com/yPfDa&bKkXe&ETYVM&ygDfS
(4 images there as well, all from Iceweasel 3, using the path to the image I dug out of "View page source")

While Iceweasel may represent a small portion of the browser market, this likely affects FF3.5 as well, which is still the default browser in several Linux distributions.

This appears to be relevant:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4420234/inline-svg-in-firefox

I'm not sure how easy/difficult setting the content type (not to mention converting the output to compliant xhtml) is, but a suboptimal fix could be to add copies of svgs as another format, for these older browsers.
Copies of svgs is the best fix imo.
I had this problem when serving with nginx.
Turned out I had to add "image/svg+xml svg svgz;" to /etc/nginx/mime.types.
Now it works in Firefox and Chrome!
@djmaze: that fixed it for me, thanks.
what about changing the alt text to home insteadof home_grey?
this would just not irritate a user as much as the _grey thing does, without it you even don't notice at first that there's something wrong ;)
check 97e1775938
(M) How about using canvg (http://code.google.com/p/canvg/) to render the SVG's?
This should work with IE8 and older firefox..
@grzuy thx, nice ;)
I think this has been fixed.
Closing the issue.
If you still see problems please open a new issue.

title: Investigate making prefix/cellar configurable via environment variables
body: It was suggested in a previous issue (can't find it, of course) that a more natural approach to custom Homebrew installations would be to make  HOMEBREW_CELLAR and HOMEBREW_PREfix respect environment variable counterparts.

I think this solution is simpler and thus preferable to the status quo:

```rb
HOMEBREW_PREfix = Pathname.new(HOMEBREW_BREW_FILE).dirname.parent # Where we link under
HOMEBREW_REPOSITORY = Pathname.new(HOMEBREW_BREW_FILE).realpath.dirname.parent # Where .git is -found-

# Where we store built products; /usr/local/Cellar if it exists,
# otherwise a Cellar relative to the Repository.
HOMEBREW_CELLAR = if (HOMEBREW_PREfix+"Cellar").exist?

HOMEBREW_PREfix+"Cellar"
else
  HOMEBREW_REPOSITORY+"Cellar"
end
```

Obviously, we can't just remove the current behavior as it would break existing installations.
but we could enable support for the environment variable version and then remove the current behavior in 1.0.

Ultimately, I think the ideal semantics are:

 * The default behavior, with no environment variable set, is the same as the current default behavior: Cellar and prefix relative to the `brew` executable.
* If `HOMEBREW_ROOT` is set, then `HOMEBREW_PREfix = HOMEBREW_ROOT` and `HOMEBREW_CELLAR = HOMEBREW_ROOT/Cellar`.
* If `HOMEBREW_PREfix` and/or `HOMEBREW_CELLAR` are set, use them, the fallbacks being HOMEBREW_ROOT and then the location of the `brew` executable.
So one could set any combination of `HOMEBREW_ROOT`, `HOMEBREW_PREfix`, and `HOMEBREW_CELLAR`, or none at all, and have a working installation.
I'm not sure I understand what benefit this gives us (particularly given we'll have to support the old way).
could you maybe illustrate with some more full paths?

Basically I want to be able to do something like:

HOMEBREW_PREfix=/usr/local
HOMEBREW_CELLAR=$HOME/.homebrew

and keep the repository somewhere else, like ~/src/homebrew, without manually symlinking the brew executable into /usr/local.
Can't you just set HOMEBREW_REPOSITORY already for that to work?
seems a pretty esoteric case for complicating that code but I'd review a pull before negging.
No, none of the HOMEBREW_* constants are configurable at all.
I don't think it's an esoteric case, the current behavior of manually symlinking the brew executable some place is described as a method for alternate installation in the wiki.
IMO setting an environment variable is much more user-friendly.

I should add that I'm fine to drop this if nobody thinks it's a worthwhile thing to do, but it was suggested somewhere as a simpler alternative to the current mechanism for doing custom installs like this, and my hope is that we could eventually do away with the current code leaving only the simple version intact.
I could have sworn this stuff was configurable using environment variables.
If it isn't it is worthwhile.
Currently, the HOMEBREW_CACHE location can be configured.
This would be good to have be configurable
(M) Proof of concept: https://github.com/jacknagel/homebrew/compare/prefix
probably have to protect from setting these to some batshit insane crazy locations, or each other, etc.

body: I can't see any post on the profile of many users.
I don't share with them and they don't share with me, but I should be able to see their public posts.

[11:57:48,684] GET https://diasp.org/u/staccato?_=1350381467703 [HTTP/1.1 500 Internal Server Error 473ms]

```
If I got that right https://github.com/diaspora/diaspora/blob/develop/lib/evil_query.rb#L109 needs to filter out nil/NULL.
Altough the real issue seems to be that the user deleted a post but the ShareVisibillities didn't get deleted.
Or I missed something  and the else branch here https://github.com/diaspora/diaspora/blob/develop/lib/stream/person.rb#L16 returns a nil value in the array.
Which would be even weirder.
Thank you so much for fixing it !
I didn't notice the patch before, saw it reading the 0.0.1.2 changelog.
This was a really annoying bug.
Thank you again !
Hm, apparently, the reshare was not the only cause of this problem.
According to [this post](https://diasp.org/posts/1829205), when you visit a profile from your pod URL, it can miss public posts.
I reproduce it from free-beer.ch.
I think we should re-open this issue.
A way to fix that is to force update when we visit the profile of someone.
Please open a new issue, exactly describing your problem (I'm not sure I understood it this time).

**Steps to reproduce:**
Go on the profile of someone by clicking in his name in a comment, or any other link which will give you an url like "https://ourpod.org/people/bb1c56d5ca383c16f".

**Actual behavior:**
The profile is empty, or some public post are displayed, or maybe all.

**Expect behavior:**
All public posts should be displayed

You can compare if posts are missing by going on https://thePodOfThePerson.tld/u/handleOfThePerson which displays all the public posts.

some public posts are not federated.
(so, the smaller your pod are, the bigger the chances to miss posts are.)

force check of the post when displaying a profile insteadof simply look at the cache.

title: fixed force layout .drag / .px and .py errors
body: Previous position values (.px/.py) were being set to an intermediate value in tick() processing, causing jumping and drag errors.

Only shows up in high-movement graphs; slightly visible in this example: http://bl.ocks.org/1062383 (mouse over pieces and watch the stutter as the pieces "jump" a bit) 

since o.x and o.y are updated several times (to intermediate values) throughout tick(), we have to capture
.px and .py at the beginning of the function, rather than just before we apply friction to the updated .x and .y values.
As a side-effect, the drag code had to be updated to directly modify .x and .y rather than .px and .py.
(M) If you set the previous position to the current position before simulating the forces, you're effectively setting the particle velocities to zero.
I think you're correct that the previous position isn't being updated correctly because of the way this implementation updates o.x and o.y directly when applying forces.
Perhaps the other forces should apply to o.px and o.py (in reverse) rather than to o.x and o.y.
Alternatively, we could accumulate the forces in o.fx and o.fy, and then apply them at the end.

This is the more common approach; I was trying to be clever by eliminating those extra variables, but that cleverness is introducing the artifacts you've discovered so it's probably premature optimization.
I was wondering if I might be missing something with that.
It's a bit confusing to differentiate between when the code operates on the values-as-labeled versus when it's operating on the variables as temporary storage.
I feel like I'm treading in dangerous territory here, because I'm a bit out of my element, but I've tried the reversal technique -- applying forces to .px and .py -- and it seems to work reasonably.
I'll push in a moment.
Neat, I hope to try this out soon.
It looks similar to the commit 5390ac3f853e6f48b4db66dd81e97885bbea530b from a while back.
A good test case for stability is one node connected to a hundred other nodes in a star pattern.
Didn't even see that!
New to the whole pull-request thing...
Hmm.
I tried this out, and it looks a lot less stable in the force-directed graph example in the repo (examples/force/force.html).
The nodes oscillate more strongly at the beginning and on interaction.
That's not to say we can't improve this, but it's going to require further investigation.
Closing this, but thank you for the contribution.
Please reopen if you can provide a good example of how it improves stability, and I'll take another look!

title: Latest actor mixins patch
body: This is rebased and squashed, see https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/449 for the original
I think this is interesting, and a clean way of doing it.
would it be possible to do it in a separate trait, extending Actor, insteadof placing it in Actor?
Do you see an advantage?
I'm not saying that it is a bad idea to place it in Actor.
Two reasons why I ask.

Interesting to see if we miss something in Actor to enable this kind of
thing to be written in pure user code.

This could potentially be an optional add-on, placed in akka.pattern, to
keep Actor minimalistic.

As I understand it from your answer, it is not possible to do in user code,
at the moment.

On Tue, May 22, 2012 at 3:03 PM, Havoc Pennington <
reply@reply.github.com
> wrote:

> You could separate it but it would add code; you'd have something like,
> first the separate trait:
>
> ```scala
> trait ActorWithWhenBecoming extends Actor {
>  def whenBecoming(behavior: Receive): Receive
> }
> ```
>
> and then in actor cell or wherever the behavior stack ends up, a switch on
> actor type:
>
> ```scala
> private def wrapBecoming(behavior: Receive): Receive = actor match {
>  case a: ActorWithWhenBecoming => a.whenBecoming(behavior)
>  case _ => behavior
> }
>
> def pushBehavior(behavior: Receive): Unit =
> behaviorStack.push(wrapBecoming(behavior))
> ```
>
> I'm not sure this wins us much, it just adds source and bytecode?

Do you
> see an advantage?

>
> ---
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub:
> https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/467#issuecomment-5846335
>



-- 

Patrik Nordwall
Typesafe <http://typesafe.com/> -  The software stack for applications that
scale
Twitter: @patriknw

Right, you can do something like it in user code now but it's messy:

1. you have to "rename" receive in some idiosyncratic way, especially unpleasant in a library since other libs or apps may not use the same convention
2. you can't keep your customizations after a become() (no way to hook in to become(), the only hook is to override receive)
3. people feel compelled to make  receive final when doing this (because overriding receive again would break the mixin), but that keeps you from having more than one mixin at once

So `whenBecoming` adds a hook, "let me modify any new behavior the actor gets" and documents a chain-up convention to support mixing in multiple modifications.

I think the nicest thing here is that the mixin is completely transparent to the subtype doing the mixing-in; _all_ people have to do is add `with MyMixin` and not make  any other changes, and the mixin will work its magic.
Thanks for clarification.
I like it.
Moved to https://github.com/akka/akka/pull/492 , rebased, with rename back to aroundReceive pending discussion, at Viktor's request.

title: parse_command_line must add logging handler only once
body:
I use options module in this way:

    #settings loading
    parse_command_line() #get settings file option⋅
    parse_config_file(options.settings)
    parse_command_line() #override settings from file

but second call to parse_command_line adds additional logging handler, which duplicates intries in output log.

that's why I've separated
parse_command_line and process_options in my branch

In Tornado 3.0 you can pass final=False to all parse calls but the last to suppress any side effects, or set a callback on the definition of your settings option to load the config file during the command line parsing.
