title: Activesupport::Dependencies#load_missing_constant is slow
body: Profiling reveals that `Activesupport::Dependencies#load_missing_constant` is unnecessarily slow in development mode.
In particular, on a mid-sized project, it can consume upwards of 50ms/req by creating a new regexp object complete with interpolation and `Regexp.escape` thousands of times per request.
The problematic line is: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.0.9/activesupport/lib/active_support/dependencies.rb#L484.
The recommended solution is: pull the regexp out into a module-level constant.
(M) Or, better yet, get a `Method` object from the regexp's `#method(:=~)` out into a module-level constant and pass that directly into the block argument of `#reject`.

agreed, this could cause a slowdown in development especially in apps with lots of AR associations as `AR::Base.compute_type` can end up calling `load_missing_constant` a few times for each association definition.
I would still have some doubts about it being called thousands of times though - it sounds excessive and it does a bunch of file stats that I would've thought overwhelm the savings from this change.
I'd question why we're cleaning the backtrace though - we already have a backtrace cleaner so what's the point of it here?
@wycats can you explain?
(M) The block passed to `#reject` is called `(number of lines in the backtrace of #load_missing_constant) * (number of times #load_missing_constant is called)`.
(M) If the backtrace has `60` lines and there are `25` models, that's `1500` calls to the block passed to `#reject`.
adding middlewares and models only increases this cost.
(M) Mongoid loads all models using `#load_missing_constant` during each request in development.
The regexp in the block passed to `#reject` is constant in the sense that the regexp in it is the same in every call.
That regexp should be a module-level constant rather than be re-created in each call to `#load_missing_constant` `caller.size` times.

That would slightly refactor the existing implementation, with the tradeoff being the extra memory needed to store one regexp forever but the benefit being that the regexp is created only once during boot and not during any of the requests in development mode rather than being created thousands of times per request in development mode.
Okay, I can see if you're reloading all of your models then you're going to get a performance hit.
If Mongoid reloads everything using `#load_missing_constant` how does it know which constants to load?
Anyway even if you cache the method in a constant you're going to be calling it 1500 times - I still want to know why we're filtering it here.
Mongoid loads all files (using Activesupport's mechanism) in `app/models/**/*.rb`.
It's using `require_dependency` so it shouldn't be hitting load_missing_constant - have you got a backtrace showing where this happens?
You're right, most of the model classes are being loaded with `require_dependency`.
Nevertheless, I am In fact seeing `#load_missing_constant` being called dozens of times per request.

The model classes Include modules and validate with validators which Activesupport must go out and find with `#load_missing_constant`, and the controllers generally have multiple ancestors which Activesupport must go out and find with `#load_missing_constant`.

The filter is there for lines [506](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.0.9/activesupport/lib/active_support/dependencies.rb#L506) and [509](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.0.9/activesupport/lib/active_support/dependencies.rb#L509) of the same file, which raise the exception with a filtered backtrace, where the filter excludes all lines with `/path/to/activesupport/lib/active_support/dependencies.rb` to maintain the illusion that activesupport isn't involved and make  it easier for users to spot where they made a mistake in referencing a missing constant.

Perhaps that filter should be factored out into a separate method, and lines [506](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.0.9/activesupport/lib/active_support/dependencies.rb#L506) and [509](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v3.0.9/activesupport/lib/active_support/dependencies.rb#L509) changed to call that method and raise the returned exception (with the filtered backtrace).
The calls to both `#caller` and `#reject` would be moved to that method.
This would be even better since `#caller` would only be called in case the constant actually can't be -found-.
In which case I would certainly like to see the result of `#caller` and fix the mistake.
but in normal operation, where the constant is indeed -found-, `#caller` would not be called at all from `#load_missing_constant`.

title: every node for itself
body:
Setup : 

	5 similar nodes : 

	btrainer-1.182	(192.168.1.182)	(Current Master before incident) 
	btrainer-1.186 (192.168.1.186)
	btrainer-1.136	(192.168.1.136)
	btrainer-13.137	(192.168.13.137)
	btrainer-1.138	(192.168.1.138)

ES Configs : (version : 0.19.8)

	cluster.name: btrainer
	discovery.zen.ping.multicast.enabled: false
	discovery.zen.ping.unicast.hosts: [ "192.168.1.182:10300", "192.168.1.186:10300", "192.168.1.136:10300", "192.168.13.137:10300", "192.168.1.138:10300" ]
	http.port: 10200
	index.number_of_replicas: 4
	transport.tcp.port: 10300

Java options : 

	-Des-foreground=yes 
	-Des.path.home=/elasticsearch 
	-Xms4096m 
	-Xmx20480m 
	-Djline.enabled=true 
	-XX:+useParNewGC 
	-XX:+useConcMarkSweepGC 
	-XX:+CMSParallelRemarkEnabled 
	-XX:SurvivorRatio=8 
	-XX:MaxTenuringThreshold=1 
	-XX:CMSInitiatingOccupancyFraction=75 
	-XX:+useCMSInitiatingOccupancyOnly 
	-cp /elasticsearch/lib/*:/elasticsearch/lib/sigar/* 
	org.elasticsearch.bootstrap.ElasticSearch

problem :

This problem repeats itself every 5-12 hours period.
When everything running smoothly (cluster is green) 1 node goes down and everynode creates its own cluster (not 1/4 split, 1/1/1/1/1 split).
The sample problem happened exactly at 22:06, we have a job checking cluster state every minute.
This cluster mainly used for training so we have heavy traffic spikes on both reads and writes when jobs are triggered (also some continious small reads).
1) What happened to btrainer-1.138 ?
2) Even if 1 node (btrainer-1.138) behaves irrationally why didn't the cluster split by 1/4; why did other nodes lose the master btrainer-1.182 ?

Logs :

you can check the logs from the nodes : https://gist.github.com/3510448
Hey, does this still happen to you or have you -found- the issue?
Your gist is not available anymore to take a closer look.

we -found- out that on busy cluster data nodes can have long garbage collections, thus we created separate master nodes (1 master for each data node on same machine as data node but with different port) for leader selection purposes only to avoid any gc from splitting our cluster.
so yes, we -found- out the issue is about long gc, and we avoid it with master only nodes.

title: SystemStackError stack level too deep - actionpack (4.0.0.beta1) lib/action_dispatch/middleware/reloader.rb:70
body:
I upgraded to Rails 4.0beta1 and Ruby 2.0 and now every time I try to open my rails app from a new browser session (every time I clear my cookies), I get:

```ruby
SystemStackError in AnythingController#Index
stack level too deep
```

The controller can be anything, it happens on all pages.

The full traceback is just:

```ruby
actionpack (4.0.0.beta1) lib/action_dispatch/middleware/reloader.rb:70
```

Simply refreshing the page make s it load and the full traceback is just that 1 single line.
Any ideas what it could be and how to troubleshoot?
could you reproduce in a new application?
No, I cannot.
So unless you give us more information about how to reproduce it, we can't do anything :anguished:
I would've thought the traceback should provide more than just that single line.
How would I troubleshoot?
-- I will try to remove routes 1 at a time, but shouldn't actionpack give more than just 1 line?

Yes, it gives you more than 1 line, but in your case, you are doing something very wrong so when trying to give you the stack trace something is called in circular, so Ruby can't give you the information.
see the description of the SystemStackError class http://ruby-doc.org/core-2.0/SystemStackError.html
I've identified the method causing this weird error.

It is in my audit_session model:

```ruby
  def self.current_session_for(current_user, request)
    self.find_or_create_by(
      :updated_at.gt =>  MAX_AUDIT_SESSION_IDLE.ago,
      user: current_user,
      request_host: request.host,
      request_domain: request.domain,
      request_port: request.port,
      remote_ip: request.env.has_key?("HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR") ?

request.env["HTTP_X_FORWARDED_FOR"] : request.remote_ip,
      user_agent: request.env['HTTP_useR_AGENT'],
      browser_lang: request.env['HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE']
    )
  end
```

The method is called from my ApplicationController as:

```ruby
  def current_audit_session
    @current_audit_session ||= AuditSession.current_session_for(current_user, request)
  end
```

If I uncomment the self.find_or_create_by then the application loads first but no audit_session model is created obviously.
What am I doing wrong in that method?

update: I have an after_create callback that runs this:

```ruby
    def retrieve_geocode
      if remote_ip.present?

Geocodeworker.perform_async(Mongoid.default_session.options[:database].to_s,
         self.class.model_name, self.id, remote_ip)
      end
    end
```

I changed the Geocodeworker line to: 

```ruby
    Geocodeworker.perform_async(Mongoid.default_session.options[:database].to_s,
         self.class.model_name.to_s, self.id, remote_ip)
```

And the problem went away.
Why would using self.class.model_name insteadof self.class.model_name.to_s in a model cause a stack level too deep error?
It's hard to debugthese kind of problems without some running code to play with.
If you want to figure out what happened you need to dig depper into perform_async and what methods on the `ModelName` are called.
As it is application related and not Rails related I am closing this issue.
Ive been having a similar problem with the stack level too deep error.
My problem happens when using a transaction.
If i try to save the record outside of a transaction is works as expected.
Only when I try to save them inside a transaction.
Ive stripped down the transaction code to just a single object (i'll eventually have multiple) and I cant get this to save by itself.
Again if i pull it out of a transaction and just save it alone, it works.

return @resource.success = "ok"
      end
        rescue Exception => e
      # TODO need to figure out how to pass exception message back to controller
          return @resource.errors
        end     
      end
    end
end
Also having this problem, on rails 4 release version.
Rails Admin gem could be the issue as I'm using that.
Doesn't seem to occur until I modify a file in development (even simple ones that have nothing to do with any executing code), the auto-reload fails.
If I re-start the server everything works as it should.
@stakach can you reproduce this issue in a fresh Rails application?
If so please upload it to GitHub so that we can take a look.
Will do over the weekend :)

title: Invalid SQL line
body:
I am running Mysql for this, and when accessing commitsController#show, I was getting the following error:

ActionView::Template::Error (Mysql::Error: You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near 'nu
ll)' at line 1: select `notes`.

* FROM `notes`  Where `notes`.`project_id` = 23 AND `notes`.`noteable_id` = 'b7898c8df4ad1bf9db37b1e278fd3b5ae9488b1b' AND `notes`.`noteable_type` = 
'commit' AND (line_code not null)):

It appears you cannot just do "variable not null" in MySQL.
It should be "variable IS not null".
This should also work with SQLite.

notes.where(:noteable_id => commit.id, :noteable_type => "commit").where("line_code is not null")

title: [Security][Acl] security identity username change
body: I didn't find any way to update security identity username in Acl, I think it should be very useful to Include in MutableAclProvider a method to do this.
Another method for removing all ACEs from a SecurityIdentity would be useful too.

Same issue

same here...
why not use the unique id of the user insteadthe username?
i don't know whats the reason that the username is used.
i changed the file userSecurityIdentity.php to work with the userid + adjusted the getters in MutableAclProvider.php to use getuserId().
thats all and it works because i can now change the username without loosing the permissions.
cheers

Same issue here, 
acl should implement user_id insteadof username.
@Barfly acl should not depend on any user property.
Application must provide unique user property to depend on.
And like to see something like getuserIdentity() insteadof getusername()
Have also discovered this issue after implementing a 'change user' feature into my application.
Same issue here.
In my application the username is the e-mail address so if the user wants to change it he loses all ACLs.
ping @schmittjoh
Same here.
Anyone has find a solution?
even a tricky one @stof ?
I don't have one.
I'm not using the ACL system in my projects
@stof Do you know anyone who is able to make  it progress?

@schmittjoh in [Symfony/Component/Security/Acl/Domain/userSecurityIdentity](https://github.com/symfony/symfony/blob/master/src/Symfony/Component/Security/Acl/Domain/userSecurityIdentity.php#L56) you create a userSecurityIdentity from the userName field.
We are kind of stuck here because we want our users to be able to change their username and still have access to their content.
Do you have any idea how to update the username without breaking ACLs?
Thx

So, I tried what @giorrrgio said e.g change getusername by getId but I think that's not the right way to do it because userInterface never implements getId and in my opinion, we should never implement stuff based on ids...

As I looked thought MutableAclProvider, it's quite clear that securityidentity is constructed with usernames which indeed can be tricky if our users change their username/email...
I am triing to find a way to update ACLs with the new username.
@fabpot , do you have any idea of it's the right way to do it?
Thx
Same issue!
One trick that we use in order to never loose ACL is to generate unique id for the username and make  people loged in with email for example.
Old user can still connect with there username.
The id never change but users can still change everything else!
I do not really understand... What property you set in providers?

>providers:
>   users:
>      entity: { class: Project\userBundle\Entity\user, property: email }

And How to be created after the objectidentity?

> $idObject = ObjectIdentity::fromDomainObject($user);

I do not know if I should ask here or open a new issue.. You'd know tell me about how to delete row in the table acl_security_identities, for example when user is unsubscribe.
Example: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/16904285/remove-update-security-identities-acl-symfony2
I asked a similar question on the Symfony group without much more answer.
My problem was to delete a security identity when a user is deleted, but you could push the solution further to apply it to username changes as well.

https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/symfony2/mGTXlTWiMs8/discussion

Beware: this solution is pretty dirty, but since @dupuchba asked for one, here it is !
cc: @stof
This still an issue?
@vpassapera Yes, up to now, this is still an open issue.
I just sent another PR, hoping to provide a clean fix for this.

I think this, combined with no easy way to pull back multiple records from large tables using a user's security credentials indicates that Symfony's security really hasn't been well thought out or completed.
Security is as basic a component of any web application.
@Codepadawan You are only talking about the ACL part of the Symfony Security.
@fabpot True.
Maybe my comment was too harsh then.
To me the simplest solution seems to be (and I haven't tried it yet) is make  another field in my user table for a username (eg.

"loginName") which as far as the user is concerned is the "username" they login with; they could change this whenever they wanted; alter loaduserByusername() in my user repository to search by that field instead, and store another value in username which cannot be changed by the user - perhaps the id?
Does that sound like a reasonable workaround?
I know nothing about the ACL sub-system and that's probably the main issue here ;) I use voters instead.
That's why I've just created #8848
Because I need to use multiple user-systems in the application I'm planning on using using UUID for the user's id so I can uniquely identify them.
Maybe this is also a good idea to implement in Symfony Security Component ACL?
Having looked at it more deeply, I think its actually quite simple.
When you change a user's username you simply update the identifier field in acl_security_identities.
just some direct SQL will suffice.
@Codepadawan please refer to #8650 The code is ready.
however, I'm missing a bit of time to right the tests and update the PR to fit the template.
however, the solution has been tested and is already in use in the current project I'm working on.
I'll update the PR as soon as I have the time.

title: implemented strict validation concept
body:
### problem

Some validation is connected are not connected with end user and breaking it is a bugthan problem with user input.
Some peaces of it can be emberded to DB(like foreign keys), but some are not.
And I think it's a good idea to use AM validators to do such checks as well.

### use case

``` ruby
class user < ARB
  validates_presence_of :author
end
```

`#author` is usually set in controller from `current_user`.

If somebody forgets to do it - user see error: 

`Author cann't be blank`

That he can not correcterize.
More over dev team is not notified about the problem.

### solution

In order to deliver debuginformation to dev team
insteadof display error message to end user
implemented `validate!` method that generates validator 
that always raise exception when fails.
I like the idea.
I am used to write those validations manually as before filters, but having a convenience method is good.
however, I don't think the responsibility of deciding if the validator should be strict or not should be on the caller, I think it should be on the validator itself.

We could probably have the following syntax:

    validates :foo, :presence => true, :strict => true

title: weechat: switch from cmake  to configure
body:
* Switch to using `configure`
* Remove `head` because it requires gtk.
* add a build time dep on gettext, otherwise link errors.
* add `--disable-perl` to stop segfault on program exit.
* add `--disable-aspell` which is still being reviewed.
* add `--disable-static` to stop building duplicate plugins.
* add `--disable-python` unless Python is a framework.
* Note that the one `inreplace` is fixed in HEAD.
(M) * Delete the plugin symlinks to stop runtime warnings.

Weechat-0.3.7 can be built using cmake  or configure, but their
cmake  build scripts are prone to errors when building the ruby
bindings.

By switching to `configure` the formula is greatly
simplified, and all the plugins it creates get neatly installed
into lib+'weechat/plugins' automatically.

(M) Weechat `head` builds require `gtk` even if the `gtk` gui is
not enabled, which it isn't because it's b0rked.
(M) So remove head.

(M) Weechat comes with an internal gettext and libintl that cause
errors when linking.
So add a dep on Homebrew's gettext.

As reported by another user and confirmed through gdb, the perl
plugin causes a segfault on exit.
(M) So disable building that.

(M) Aspell is still under construction in Homebrew, and weechat will
compile that plug by default.
(M) So disable aspell for now.
(M) Disable the static plugins and delete the plugin symlinks.

That
leaves only one `.so` for each plugin and stops a dozen warnings
when running weechat about _can't load duplicate plugins._

Disable building the Python plugin unless Python is a framework
because it will build but fail to load the plugin with an error
that it can't dlopen a module expected in flat namespace.

Even if we add a dep on Homebrew/dupes/ncurses to get the wide
variety of it, that formula doesn't actually create `-lnursesw`.
So that is not added, because it can't be -found-.

The gtk interface to weechat is not added as a user option because
it runs but doesn't make  a useable gui.
(M) It's blank & unresponsive.

Weechat compiles, runs, and connects to freenode without error
using clang and llvm on Lion, tested against system Ruby, system
Python, and Homebrew Python frameworks.
fixes #11835 and #12066
@zmanji Please test this with your ruby-1.9 and rbenv.

You can do that like this:

    brew rm weechat
    brew install -vd https://github.com/2bits/homebrew/raw/83e1edf919d0314da3f0b36444892195a2fbb132/Library/Formula/weechat.rb

It switches to using configure and fixes everything, but I'd like to -make  SURE- you can build it.
There are no options anymore.
It just builds the plugins for the programs it can detect the way the developers intended, except for perl which I disabled because it crashes when you exit weechat-curses.

I did not get an error about ruby but I got the following problem:
````
weechat-guile.c:26:10: fatal error: 'libguile.h' file not -found-
#Include <libguile.h>
         ^
weechat-guile-api.c:26:10: fatal error: 'libguile.h' file not -found-
#Include <libguile.h>
````

You need to disable guile by default.
Funky but my fault, as I had guile installed.
I figured it would just skip it if guile was absent, because that plugin is listed as `(default=compiled if -found-)`.
I'll work on it some more, and thanks for your time.

@zmanji  The above commit, 49b34e2,  fixes the `guile` error by using `'--disable-guile' unless Formula.factory('guile').linked_keg.exist?`

While testing the `head` url just now, which I forgot to do earlier, I -found- that head will not build because it requires the m4 macros from gtk to be present, which means a dep on gtk just to compile it even though `weechat-gtk` is blank and unresponsive.

```
configure.in:212: error: possibly undefined macro: AM_PATH_GTK_2_0
```

So I removed the head url because there's no way to justify that dep.
Good times.
@2bits Thanks for working on this.
Is there a way to send some fixes upstream?
This seems to be a little crazy.
`brew home weechat` then look for their bugreporting link on the right side of that page.
The `guile` issue with configure, the perl crash on exit, and the Ruby w/Cmake  failure are all worth telling them about, probably in separate issues.
The warnings about can't load duplicate plugins is annoying, but who knows if they really care about warnings.
Pulled this.

title: byte array to byte array is very slow.
body: Mapping a byte[] property to a byte[] property is terribly slow.
It is typically 50 times slower than a plain Array.Copy().
It seems automapper is handling byte[] as an IEnumerable<byte> and maps every byte individually.
So the problem probably exists with arrays of all primitive types.
could you add  these special cases to the automapper?
I came across this message https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups=#!topic/automapper-users/bCKicMmVgHY .
It suggests it only occurs on a 64bit machine.
I've tested it using a 64bit machine, testing on a 32 bit machine would take me more effort so I'd rather not.
I think I'm seeing similar behavior on 32-bit.

see here, where I'm copying an array of length 100000. 

https://gist.github.com/4505673

Output (ms)

Automapper: 229
Plain copy: 0

This is 2.2.0 from NuGet.
Is there any fix for this issue?
We are having the same problem, would love a fix!
I wrote a fix (dedicated mapper) for this that reduced the mapping time drastically.

The fix targets the mapping of primitive arrays, with the following conditions:
- source and destination property should be an array
- type of the array elements should be a primitive or a string
- source array element type should match the destination array element type

So the mapper is used to map for instance:
int[] to int[]
string[] to string[]
byte[] to byte[]
...
but not for:
int[] to double[]
int[] to string[]
int[] to List<int>
These last mappings still use the original code (items are converted one by one).
To test the performance, I based myself on the test provided by @mick-wilson.

I had the following timings:

before the fix:
Automapper: 146 (ms)
Plain copy: 0 (ms)

with the fix:
Automapper: 33 (ms)
Plain copy: 0 (ms)

Still a bit overhead in the mapping, but it's still reduced to almost a fifth of the original duration.

(If you run the mapping several times, the duration is also reduced to zero: the first invocation seems to take some initialization time)

I'll create a pull request for this fix
"Still a bit overhead in the mapping, but it's still reduced to almost a fifth of the original duration.

(If you run the mapping several times, the duration is also reduced to zero: the first invocation seems to take some initialization time)"

The subsequent invocations skip the JIT compilation and verification steps.
Giggity.

I'll merge - I've got a branch that's been open for a while that's a PCL
version of AutoMapper.
This will go in with that.

On Wed, Mar 13, 2013 at 4:26 PM, mick-wilson <notifications@github.com>wrote:

> "Still a bit overhead in the mapping, but it's still reduced to almost a
> fifth of the original duration.

(If you run the mapping several times, the
> duration is also reduced to zero: the first invocation seems to take some
> initialization time)"
>
> The subsequent invocations skip the JIT compilation and verification steps.

>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/AutoMapper/AutoMapper/issues/279#issuecomment-14869635>
> .

title: change spl to SPL
body: as extension names are case sensitive.

➜  ~  php -r 'var_dump(extension_loaded("spl"));'
    bool(true)

    ➜  ~  php -r 'var_dump(extension_loaded("SPL"));'
    bool(true)

Yes extension_loaded is case-insensitive, but:
```
$ php -m | grep -i spl
SPL
```

And as said in http://pear.php.net/manual/en/guide.developers.package2.dependencies.php 
> < providesextension >, like all other extension-related functions in PHP, is case-sensitive.
Do not use "pdo" for the "PDO" extension, or your dependency will always fail.
but as I don't see any reason why a package can exist in several cases, I will compare case-insensitively in my program (see also : http://bugs.debian.org/696743)

title: xgettext cannot extract strings from templates
body:
Consider this example:

<input type="text" value={{ _("search term") }} />

I can extract the _() wrapped string with xgettext properly but when i translate and use tornado.locale.load_gettext_translations(), I get the translation of "search", not "search term".

PO file is like below:

#: templates/index.html:1
msgid "search term"
msgstr "terim ara"

but i only see "terim" in the rendered page, not "terim ara".

The problem here is the original string is the value of an attribute and didn't escaped by double quotes, thus the returned string from load_gettext_translations() is not escaped and contains whitespace.
The returned string from the translated text should be quoted by default, otherwise all we get is the first word before the whitespace.
You mean you have <tag attr={{_('string')}}> insteadof <tag attr="{{_('string')}}">?
You're supposed to put the quotes in the html; the template system never provides them for you (why does it work for "search term" but not "terim ara", since both have spaces?)
If you put the quotes in the html for "input" tag, then its "value" attribute key's value can not be extracted.

Try this example:

"""
$ cat index.html
 <input type="text"value="{{ _('search term') }}" name="q2" />

$ xgettext -L Python --keyword=_  index.html -d example -o example.pot

$ ls example.pot
ls: a.pot: No such file or directory
"""

If you put quotes around your i18n wrapper, you can't extract it via xgettext.
If you don't, you can extract the strings and "example.pot" template file is created but tornado can't get the translated strings properly from example.mo file as I wrote on the first comment.
Tornado can't substitute the original string with the translated string as intended.
Only the first word of the translation is substituted.
What's in index.html?
That didn't come through in your example.
Sorry, markdown beat my html.

here:

\<input type="text" value="{{ _('search term') }}" name="q2" />
OK, so the problem is in how you're invoking xgettext.
You're telling xgettext it's python, and parsed according to the rules of python the `_()` call appears in a string literal so it is correctly ignoring it.
We need to either teach xgettext about tornado template syntax, or maybe just run the template compiler as a preprocessor.
I'm not sure what sort of extensibility xgettext has so I'm not sure how to add this.

title: Chrome mangles styles for tooltips with reset
body:
As per Louis Lazaris on disqus:

Hey, Paul and Divya.
A couple of us working on a project for SitePoint discovered something interesting regarding CSS resets and the HTML5 "required" attribute on form inputs.
As you probably know, the browsers that offer support for "required" will display their own custom tool-tip style message when you try to submit the form without filling in a required field.
(M) This "message" has certain default styling.
(M) A CSS reset that removes borders and/or backgrounds from the "div" element will apparently remove the styles from that tool-tip.

To work around this, we didn't want to remove "div" from the reset, so insteadchanged the first line of the reset to look like this:

 html, body, body div, span, object, iframe,

 So this way it's resetting the div's styles inside of a descendant selector ("body div").
I have no idea where the browsers get that tool tip from, nor can I see it in the generated source.
but it seems the tooltip element is not a child of the body, yet it still gets reset.
Not sure how that works, or why the fix even works, but it does seem to correct it.
Do you know of anyone else having documented this issue, or resolved it in another way?
We only discovered this in the last 24 hours or so, so if there's a better solution, we'd be happy to hear it.
chris coyier -found- this as well.
heres a screenshot he sent over.
http://cl.ly/5Cqh
Can confirm that changing "div" to "body div" in the reset styles selector appears to resolve this issue.
I tested Louis' fix and it indeed fixes it.
I also don't seen any problem with changing that first line of the reset.
divs = should be inside the body anyway.

What I would think would control this is:

input::-webkit-input-speech-button {  }   but no properties you give this affect the popup in any way.
I think this is a Chrome bug.
DIV styling should in no way affect a validation popup, which should be treated as a pseudo element.
If one other person agrees with me I'll report it.
I def agree.
It's a chrome bug.
Link up the ticket here afterwards.
Thx Chris
http://code.google.com/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=75920
Another test case from jdbartlett.

Love the Marker Felt 

http://jsfiddle.net/p7kK5/

here is a better version of that test case: http://jsfiddle.net/p7kK5/2/

I simply added a name attribute so that Opera can do form validation.

just a wild guess but I would assume these tooltips would be part of the shadow DOM (The same goes for the date picker control) and for whatever reason it's picking up document styles, hence why body div doesn't interfere with it?
Does this bugapply to all possible shadow DOM elements?

My test case with the CSS reset on JSBin is here, if anyone wants to mess around with it:

http://jsbin.com/oveno3/edit

here's a thought:

would there be any harm in removing "div" from the reset altogether?

The only property/value pairs in the reset styles that seem to matter for the div element are font-size and font, but wouldn't those be irrelevant for div since text is normally not placed as a direct child of div?
Maybe I'm wrong, I'm really not sure if those styles are necessary for the div.
@impressivewebs Yeah, I don't see the benefit of including `div` in the reset.
(M) Text in a `div` will inherit the `font` values from `body` anyway.
I think there is some appetite to move away from using a reset altogether.

g++ -shared -s -static-libgcc -o marked.dll tmp.def bayesCR.o cjs.o C:/Program Files/R/R-2.15.2/library/Rcpp/lib/i386/libRcpp.a -lgfortran -LC:/PROGRA~1/R/R-215~1.2/bin/i386 -lR

We're now using the R package build system directly for building native libraries.
In this context there is a known Rcpp constraint that you can't have Rcpp installed in a directory with spaces in the path.
This issue has been resolved in the development version of Rcpp (which you can get from svn or R-forge).

title: added utilities to help setup static geometry efficiently.
body: I've been baking the static geometry in my scene together into larger BufferGeometry objects which are much more efficient.

This branch contains some utility methods I've added that has made it a lot easier

 * THREE.SceneUtils.mergeMeshesRecursive - add a node tree in world-space into a Geometry
 * THREE.SceneUtils.deduplicateMaterials - optimize for duplicate materials in a mesh
 * THREE.GeometryUtils.make BufferGeometries - split a Geometry into an array of BufferGeometry objects.
In doing so, I moved WebGLRenderer's sortFacesByMaterial function into Geometry.make Groups (so I could use it in make BufferGeometries).
I think it's a bit tidier there as it only affects Geometry and reduces WebGLRenderer by 70 lines.
So here's a pull request in case you want them in the main release.
just to explain a little more, this can help you do some manual draw call batching, kind of like Unity does automatically: http://docs.unity3d.com/documentation/Manual/DrawCallBatching.html

A agree that `GeometryUtils.triangulateQuads()` should not be calling `geometry.computeFaceNormals()` and `geometry.computeVertexNormals()`, but should insteadclone the normals that are already present in the quad.
So I support that particular change.
I can't comment on the implementation of the other changes in this PR, however.

body: omniORB is a robust high performance CORBA ORB for C++ and Python.
Python is required by the omniORB IDL compiler.
The omniORBpy Python mapping needs to be installed whithin the omniORB prefix.
omniORBpy is required in order to reach CORBA from Python.
The user needs to amend the PYTHONPATH in order to use both packages.

but when trying to use this formula on Lion, I got the following problem.

clang++ -o catior -O2 -fno-common -bind_at_load -L../../../../lib -L../../../../../lib catior.o -lomniORB4 -lomnithread
    ld: warning: directory not -found- for option '-L../../../../../lib'
    Undefined symbols for architecture x86_64:
      "operator<<=(unsigned int&, cdrStream&)", referenced from:
          _CORBA_Unbounded_Sequence<IOP::TaggedProfile>::operator<<=(cdrStream&) in catior.o
    ld: symbol(s) not -found- for architecture x86_64
    clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)

but this is already known issue.

https://trac.macports.org/ticket/32062

The small patch can fix this problem.

http://www.omniorb-support.com/pipermail/omniorb-list/2012-February/031202.html

I applied the following patch to current formula and it works fine.
I hope this will be of some help.

--- omniorb_org.rb	2012-11-24 17:40:21.000000000 +0900
    +++ omniorb.rb	2012-11-24 17:26:38.000000000 +0900
    @@ -13,6 +13,10 @@
     
       option 'python', 'Enable Python mappings'
     
    +  def patches
    +    DATA
    +  end
    +
       def install
         python_exec = `python-config --exec-prefix`.strip
     
    @@ -62,3 +66,19 @@
        end
       end
     end
    +
    +__END__
    +--- a/Include/omniORB4/CORBA_sysdep.h
    ++++ b/Include/omniORB4/CORBA_sysdep.h
    +@@ -231,6 +231,11 @@
    + #endif
    + 
    + 
    ++#if defined(__clang__)
    ++#  define OMNI_NO_INLINE_FRIENDS
    ++#endif
    ++
    ++
    + //
    + // Windows DLL hell
    + //

Exception
    RuntimeError
Error
    Comment#parent_author delegated to parent.author, but parent is nil: #<Comment id: nil, text: "Yeah it will be in the next release.

I run my pod o...", commentable_id: nil, author_id: 7593, guid: "286a0ce7d079114b", author_signature: "dZW0LoAOv8KkU4YTuS4NhyBXz1AfzCUGg8fj7JYMa56YI4WRkrf...", parent_author_signature: "dZW0LoAOv8KkU4YTuS4NhyBXz1AfzCUGg8fj7JYMa56YI4WRkrf...", created_at: nil, updated_at: nil, likes_count: 0, commentable_type: nil>

    /home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/diaspora/relayable.rb:24:in `rescue in parent_author'
    /home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/diaspora/relayable.rb:21:in `parent_author'
    /home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/postzord/receiver/public.rb:67:in `xml_author'
    /home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/postzord/receiver.rb:15:in `author_does_not_match_xml_author?'

/home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/postzord/receiver/public.rb:55:in `save_object'
    /home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/postzord/receiver/public.rb:26:in `receive!'
/home/tom/dev/diaspora/lib/postzord/receiver.rb:11:in `perform!'

/home/tom/dev/diaspora/app/models/jobs/receive_unencrypted_salmon.rb:14:in `perform'
```
We all do, what's your ratio of processed/failed at the stats page?
Good to know, but what is the reason for this and I guess it is a bug, isn't it?
The ratio is 77978 processed/6099 failed, i.e.
statistically about every 13th message fails.
I got one worker and 10 queues.

We have two main failures here:

1) You received a comment/like etc but never got the corresponding post.
This is either because your pod was offline/not reachable when it was written or because the sender thinks you should've got but never send it to you.
We're not sure what's the exact cause, but as result you see this "but parent is nil" etc.
errors.
We often see about 10% of these going through when retried a couple of hours later, so some might be just order issues when sending stuff out.
2) The second common failure type is "guid already taken".
This time you received a post/comment/like again even though you have it already.
So this is likely because the sender things you didn't get it due some network instabilities or whatever and thus retries.
Or we start to run into GUID collisions and need to make  it longer.
Both of these aren't easy to reproduce in a clean environment and thus extremely hard to debug.
Nonetheless we don't have the feeling that their is a major loss of information.
And Sidekiq  with it's automatic retries should improve the situation a bit (#3993).

title: check for exists? of S3 attachment causes Net::HTTP[s3.amazonaws.com]: HEAD calls
body: I'm attaching user avatar images via Paperclip and storing them in S3, and in order to determine whether a user has uploaded an avatar or not, I'm using exists?, such as "current_user.avatar.exists?".
I noticed looking at some requests in NewRelic, that every call to exists?
is causing a call out via Net::HTTP, which is having a terrible impact on page performance when showing information about a large number of users.

The NewRelic details show it as:

    Net::HTTP[s3.amazonaws.com]: HEAD

Every single time.
I double-checked by adding a single exists?
(M) call to a controller, and sure enough, saw the HEAD call appear.
Is there a better way to check for the existence of an avatar that won't cause this?
I'm considering taking advantage of the default behavior and checking if user.avatar.url != "/headshots/original/missing.png" but that seems like a pretty weak hack.
Any suggestions would be great.
Thanks.
Empty

title: [Form] Collection items are no longer bound
body: Hi.
After the recent merge of PRs by @bschussek items from a collection are no longer bound.

My form type looks like:

`TitleType.php`
```php
$builder->add(
            'alternates',
            'collection',
            array(
                'type'          => new TitleAlternateType(),
                'allow_add'     => true,
                'allow_delete'  => true,
                'mapped'        => false,
                'options'       => array(
                    'attr' => array('class' => 'alternate')
                )
            )
        );
```
`TitleAlternateType.php`
```php
/**
     * {@inheritDoc}
     */
    public function buildForm(FormBuilder $builder, array $options)
    {
        $builder->add(
            'alternate',
            'text',
            array(
                'help' => 'Alternate spelling of the title.'
You shouldn't set `mapped` to `false`.
You probably meant to set `by_reference` to `false` instead.
(M) Removing `mapped` or setting it to the property of the entity doesn't really help.
The items is created but is missing the reference back to the owning entity.
Or this again some weird doctrine bug?
(M) Did you set `by_reference` to `false` instead?
D'Oh - my fault.
I misread `by_reference` as `property_path` for whatever reason.
Now it works.
Thanks.

title: Include dependency hierarchy is spaghetti
body:
Today I played around a bit with libclang and made a graph of Include dependencies:

https://dev.visucore.com/bitcoin/Includes.svg

Edges show a source file that is Included into another.
(M) You can hover over connections to highlight them, this can help clarify spaghetti parts.
* it would be nice to get rid of `headers.h` and Include only what we need in every compilation unit.
(M) * Newer files (such as `addrman.cpp`, `protocol.cpp`, `version.cpp`) are more well-behaved in this regard.
* `util.h`, `protocol.h` probably pull in too much.
*  the hierarchy is too deep; Include files shouldn't Include that many other Include files.

for example `headers.h`←`util.h`←`uint256.h`←`serialize.h`←`allocators.h` ...
* moving code from .h to .cpp files where possible / efficient would help reduce interdependencies
agreed on all points, but I vote for this being cleaned up over the next 6 months not in a "change the world" pull request.
Sorry @gavinandresen, see #1108 and #1109...

title: Rails 4 strong parameters support
body: This branch is a result of a discussion with @lucasmazza and @carlosantoniodasilva a few weeks ago about the best way to allow flexible support for strong_parameters.
I based my branch of the rails4 branch however I also rebased the final result to master.
The result is a slight deviation from the original plan but I think it represents a decent compromise between setting up a default configuration that is easy to override via before_filter.
(M) This sets up a new class `Devise::ParameterSanitizer` to handle permitting parameters for Devise in a central and configurable way.
I added tests for the intended usage of it.
use case: need to add a pin field for logging in?

Simply override the session params:

```ruby
class ApplicationController
  prepend_before_filter :add_allowed_devise_session_params

  private

  def add_allowed_devise_session_params
    parameters_sanitizer.permit_devise_param(:sessions, :pin)
  end
end
```

Everything is green except for one test that I wasn't sure how to handle.
It's a scoped views test that simply does `post :create` with no params and expects a 200 OK and is insteadgetting a parameter missing (due to no :user being passed in the params).
Looks good mate!
Hopefully it gets merged soon
looks great!
Waiting to see this merged to rails4 branch.
closed in favor of #2358.

title: Cannot start Flask application in a thread other than main
body:
Starting a Flask application in a thread other than the main thread does not work and produces the following:

 * Running on http://0.0.0.0:5000/
Exception in thread flask_application_thread:
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/threading.py", line 551, in __bootstrap_inner
    self.run()
  File "harness.py", line 23, in run
    self.__application.run(host = '0.0.0.0', debug= True)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Flask-0.9-py2.7.egg/flask/app.py", line 739, in run
    run_simple(host, port, self, **options)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Werkzeug-0.8.3-py2.7.egg/werkzeug/serving.py", line 615, in run_simple
    run_with_reloader(inner, extra_files, reloader_interval)
  File "/opt/python2.7/lib/python2.7/site-packages/Werkzeug-0.8.3-py2.7.egg/werkzeug/serving.py", line 529, in run_with_reloader
    signal.signal(signal.SIGTERM, lambda *args: sys.exit(0))
ValueError: signal only works in main thread

Is there a workaround.
I've tried using multiprocessing.Process which is no an option in my application.
Thanks.
Can you describe your constraints?
Why would you want to do the above?
Why was not `multiprocessing` an option?
Why do you expect a development server to be that feature-rich?
Are you aware you should use ``app.run`` only for testing purposes?
I think I may have been a little too restrictive in that last sentence.
I should have written: I rather not use multiprocessing since I'd then have to communicate with the other half of my application: the parent process.
I'm writing a test harness.
At the moment one thread, or process if I use multiprocess, runs the tests and the Flask thread/process listens for HTTP requests from the application under test.
These HTTP requests along with other stuff determine whether the test has passed or not.
I was not aware that I was to use app.run for testing only.
How would I run the Flask event loop manually?
Thanks.

On my integration tests i'm using something like that 


class RunFlask(Process):
    
    name = "Flask Process"
    sleep = 2
    
    def __init__(self, app, *args, **kw):
        Process.__init__(self)
        self.app = app
        self.port = 5000
        if kw.get("port"):
            self.port=kw["port"]

    def run(self):
        #initialize here the notification server also
        http_server = WSGIServer(('', self.port), self.app)
        http_server.serve_forever()


WSGIServer here is from gevent.
(M) Why not simply [`popen`](http://docs.python.org/2/library/subprocess.html) it?
Or pick a more natural way to [test flask applications](http://flask.pocoo.org/docs/testing/)?
If simply launching a `Flask` server for further testing is what you require.
Are you running under gevent or under Werkzeug development server?
(M) Because the error you described above is from the development server, are you perhaps running the app unintentionally with `app.run()` not enclosed in `if __name__ ...` when importing it?
I *think* I have it sorted.
Tornado allows me to fire up a server in a daemon thread.
Which is exactly what I want.

I used the information on this page

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8143141/using-flask-and-tornado-together/8247457#8247457

Thanks for all your help.
The werkzeug builtin server is not very clever for this.
just use any other wsgi server you might fancy.

title: Get add sibling url in toolbar gives error
body: In the toolbar function ```_get_add_sibling_url``` gives an error with a page that is a root node.
It is looking for an parent page in the function, but that doesn't exist because the page is a root node.

Replace the parent page lookup:
```return '%s?target=%s&position=last-child' % (reverse('admin:cms_page_add'), request.current_page.parent.pk)```

With:
```return '%s?target=%s&position=last-child' % (reverse('admin:cms_page_add'), request.current_page.parent_id or '')```

And the error will not occur anymore.
You can also remove the check in the function ```get_page_menu``` if the page is_home page.
for reference: seems to have a fix at https://github.com/jhhazelaar/django-cms/commit/dd1073a23db185c5b6e43c94f74552559115e8b9
fixed in 4ad431b1dd4fc7006689

What is going on there?
Thank you!
david
Master is now 4.1.0.beta.
https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/RAILS_VERSION

title: Colons in folder names (OS X -> Windows sync)
body:
Hey,

I noticed a rather annoying issue, that could be related to some other problems which have already been reported.
Under OS X, you can create folders with slashes in their names (e.g.
'Contracts / agreements').
This is internally represented using colons ('Contracts : agreements').
Now when you try to sync such a folder with SparkleShare, it will create a conflict on Windows (which is quite unexpected) and apparently detach the HEAD.
here is the log from the Windows machine (had to censor it because it contains sensible information).
In this case, I added a folder ROOT which contains folders PATH, PATH2 and the problematic folder 'PATH : 3'.

19:04:30 | Cmd | xxx.git | git rev-parse HEAD
```
that sounds pretty bad.
what does "git status --porcelain" in the messed up project folder say?
this may be a hard one to solve...
I'm afraid I already moved on and renamed the problematic folder.
I believe a good thing for now would be to handle the detached HEAD situation somehow and let the user know about it.
("Something went wrong, no way to fix it automatically") to let the user know what happens.
In this case I ended up with a situation where files I added to the repository just disappeared because they couldn't be pushed to the server anymore..
i looked up what Dropbox does in this situation.
they have a pretty good document about it: https://www.dropbox.com/help/145/en.
ignoring these files seems to be the only way forward.
the other option would be renaming files, but that would be annoying and would require hacking Git.
Ignoring them (maybe with some feedback to the user) seems to be a very reasonable solution in my opinion.
I unfortunately don't have the time to make  myself familiar with SparkleShare's internals right now, otherwise I'd try to come up with a solution myself.
Maybe it could be as simple as adding some entries to .gitignore?

What you should do either way is to update the documentation accordingly, I believe that's very hard to figure out for the regular user and can easily make  him believe that files are lost (that detached HEAD scenario scared the crap out of myself a few weeks ago).
@pehlert i know it's no fun, but can you try to reproduce the error and give me the output anyway?
Sure, just give me a while to setup a test environment.
It's a weird situation.
It's a clean status and the HEAD is still on the master branch.

Still, whenever I create a new file, it gets deleted immediately (as you can see in the case of blubb.txt)

Sorry for the screenshot, I'm doing this remotely and the Windows git tools give me a hard time anyway.

!
[Screenshot_3_11_13_8_49_PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/9256/245544/094a3416-8a85-11e2-8fc4-febf0d16412d.png)
Many thanks for that.
I unfortunately don't have the means to build the Windows client right now, otherwise I'd take it to a test drive.
(this issue seems to be a duplicate of #1195 btw..
I have missed that one)
it does seem to be the same issue.
anyway, this one somehow triggered an idea to the solution, where the other one didn't.

:)

this will not immediately fix the issue.
you'll still have to rename the invalid file names to -make  SURE- they appear on Windows.
also, the exclude rules are set up once you add a project to SparkleShare, so you probably want to re-add it.
at least this will prevent the problem for new setups in the future.
also, i'll have to work on way to display the ignored files, but at least this is a step in the right direction and won't destroy people's Windows setups.

title: Three.js on the iPhone/iPad
body: I just pushed a branch of my iOS JavaScript/Canvas framework Ejecta to github.

This branch features experimental WebGL support:

https://github.com/phoboslab/Ejecta/tree/next

I tried it with a few Three.js examples already, and most(?)
things seem to work, but it's still very early.

So, please let me invite to try your demos in Ejecta and report bugs :)

!
[Screen Shot 2012-12-30 at 9 19 41 PM](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/443987/36079/856367a6-52be-11e2-80a2-60a84324d276.png)
nice
Forgive me iOS noob question - is there any way how to be able to check this without Mac with OSX hardware and without rooting your iPhone / iPad?
I do have iPhone / iPad but I'm completely Windows-based, no Macs near me.

As far as I understood, the official way is supposed to require:

- Mac HW
- Mac OSX
- subscription to some Apple developer thing
- make  your own app in XCode
- somehow transfer this to your iOS HW that's only authorized to work with with that developer thing
- only once everything is finished get your app approved in AppStore and then other people can check this

but there is supposed to be also some sort of beta-testing way where apps built by one person can be tested on HW from other people without passing through AppStore first.
@alteredq apple developers can register up to 100 beta tester devices individually that can get authorized to install betas.
its an annoying process though (for both testers and developers).
the easiest way is to get an apple developer account and use XCode to build apps straight to your phone.
for some value of easiest

title: support "size": 0 for Term Facet
body: Is it possible to add support for setting "size": 0 to simple Term Facets in order to return all terms matching the hits?
This should be similar to the TermsStats Facet api.
Yes, its definitely possible.
I plan to do some refactoring in this area, once its done, we can then add this.
Great, keep up the good work :)
Excellent.
just wanted to give a big thumb up (two, even!)
to this idea.
also, when implemented this might also close #1530
+1 vote for this feature!
+1 vote for this feature
Loving elasticsearch...
I would really benefit from this feature.
Any update on the status of this issue?
Haven't had a chance to look at the issue, but past experience with earlier lucene and ESP, would suggest you are asking for a 0 to represent a null entry?
Is that really what is meant?

On Sep 5, 2012, at 2:06 PM, Michael Irey wrote:

> Loving elasticsearch...
I would really benefit from this feature.
Any update on the status of this issue?

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
Really just looking for a way to ask for all facets to be returned... Perhaps omitting the the `size` param or having it set to `all`.
Right now I have it set to a really high number.
see: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/12285371/elasticsearch-number-of-facets-returned
Why is this issue open and documentation says: "The size parameter controls how many facet entries will be returned.
It defaults to 10.
Setting it to 0 will return all terms matching the hits"?

http://www.elasticsearch.org/guide/reference/api/search/facets/terms-stats-facet.html
What is the truly behavior?
(M) @jperelli the docs you're looking at are for the *terms stats* facet, not the *terms* facet: in the terms facet setting `size` to 0 just gives you no terms back.
You are right, in a closer look, I confused this issue with that part of the docs.
Sorry!
Fellows, just an update, its high on our prio list!, we are going to go through the mentioned refactoring and implement it.
Its simpler now with Lucene 4 upgrade effectively done.
Isn't this already implemented with the "all_terms" option?
@pjrt: Nope.
The "all_terms" option says "also Include in the list terms that appear somewhere in the index for this field but that have no hits in this query" (i.e., entries with a count of zero).
but the "size" parameter says "how many items from the top of the list should I actually return?"
On 15 mrt.

2013, at 18:16, Pedro Rodriguez <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Isn't this already implemented with the "all_terms" option?

> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub.
+1 :thumbsup:

title: MVEL infinite loop in its error handling causing cluster to degrade
body: Recently I've seen requests trigger a failure, where MVEL gets into an infinite loop trying to report the exception.
This failure causes service to degrade across the entire cluster, causing timeouts on requests handled by all nodes.
These may be just for indexes with a shard on the affected machine, but it feels bigger than that.
Shared some logs and a repro with @kimchy.
Based on @nz 's report, I've submitted a patch to MVEL to solve this issue (http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/MVEL-292 ) .
(M) It is limited in scope to a single line script that start with a new line and trigger an error while executing/parsing (this example, a bad field data access).

title: ERROR: Unable to find Intel TBB install directory.
body: I've installed TBB from source, and used the binaries provided on the tbb website.
I just can't seem to get the install location correct (I've tried various locations and methods as I find them via google and the intel website).
Can someone give me a step by step on what I should be doing to get tbb recognised by hphp?
Running CentOS 5
Did you `export Cmake _PREfix_PATH=$PREfix` where `$PREfix` is the directory to which TBB was installed?
Yes, but I guess I'm getting something wrong.
Can you give me an example dir structure of your $PREfix dir
Delete Cmake Cache.txt, there are also 2 extra variables when using it from source.

export TBB_INSTALL_DIR="/home/macvicar/dev/hphp-dev/third_party/tbb22_012oss"
export TBB_ARCH_PLATFORM="intel64/cc4.1.2_libc2.5_kernel2.6.20"

Easiest and most generic thing to do when using TBB from source is to just run the generated script, which sets the required variables for you, like: 

$ source tbb22_20090809oss/build/linux_intel64_gcc_cc4.1.2_libc2.5_kernel2.6.18_release/tbbvars.sh

and you should be good to go

title: add theme attribute: textColorPrimaryInverseDisableOnly
body: would be useful for setting the textColor for Spinner items in ActionBar spinner (List nav mode).
I still run into this when using Light.DarkActionBar based themes, where I need a custom spinner item layout with which has *textColor="?attr/textColorPrimaryInverseDisableOnly".

*

implement as:

*Theme.Sherlock*

    <item name="textColorPrimaryInverseDisableOnly">@color/abs__primary_text_disable_only_holo_light</item>

*Theme.Sherlock.Light*

    <item name="textColorPrimaryInverseDisableOnly">@color/abs__primary_text_disable_only_holo_dark</item>
I'm not sure why I duplicated all the `textColor*` attributes in the first place.
They're all available on the necessary API levels...
You're duplicating them so the holo colors are only used in the action bar, and not the rest of a users app.
@mrenouf I'm not sure you should be using the textColor* attributes in your app.
for example, ?attr/textColorPrimaryInverseDisableOnly would resolve to nothing on API14+ if it was added.
(M) Yeah you're definitely better off with your own theme attributes to track these values.

title: Overriding the connectionid
body:
Hi,

I am making a class say test.cs which derives from SignalR.Hubs.Hub.cs .

When I run my application the url using SignalR becomes:

http://localhost:50378/signalr/send?transport=serverSentEvents&connectionId=92e8b7a5-65e9-4d5f-aaa1-0a0de63aff31

Is there a way to override the behaviour of generation of connectionid .
I want to give the ids based on my application probably username.
Is this a good practice to use username there?
How to override the generation of connection id?
You can either keep your own mapping from user name to connection id or you can generate your own connection ids by implementing your own `IClientIdFactory`.
More info here https://github.com/SignalR/SignalR/wiki/Extensibility.

Also, it will be helpful for others if it is mentioned that the below line is to be written in global.asax
Dependencyresolver.Register(typeof(IConnectionIdFactory), () => new CustomIdFactory());

Thanks,
Raghav
The wiki is only up to the current release.
The bits of github aren't ready for a release yet.
When they are we'll have docs for them
Hi David!
How I could do it now, there are no IClientIdFactory interface anymore.
You can't.
Also ask questions on the forum http://forums.asp.net/1254.aspx
Thanks.

title: new formula: librets
body: librets is the "official" library for communicating with RETS servers.
RETS is the Real Estate Transaction Standard, and is used to fetch information about homes for sale.
blah blah blah.
The bummer about this formula is that it requires swig > 1.3.33, and Snow Leopard ships with 1.3.31... so, there's a swig formula in here too.
No workaround for using swig 1?
The swig formula should be keg-only.
like I said, it requires swig > 1.3.33, and only 1.3.31 is available.
I'm not sure how to do the keg-only bit.
Pointers?
I wonder if you can hack configure to work around this.
Thanks though, will have a think.
added as 959f6b31acc2b85f00fa326cf5044b8b5ca0d56c
This isn't useful to me without the Ruby bindings, which require SWIG.
If you're not going to install SWIG you should also add `--disable-ruby` to the formula.
@mikemcquaid - Given that your stance on duplicates is well-known, do you mind if I take a crack at a keg-only SWIG2?
For what it's worth, Snow Leopard provides an ancient version of SWIG (1.3.31) and no version of SWIG 2 at all... if that helps when discussing duplication ;)
I'd rather you spent your time trying to hack the package to work with an older SWIG but I'm not your boss :)
If memory serves, there's a bugin SWIG that's fixed in 1.3.33 that librets relies on to function.
I've emailed their list to try to determine what it is... it may be that it only affects one language's binding, and that could just be a known caveat.
Yeh, I guess I'm generally on the side of attempting to (when possible) work around bugs in the Apple-provided versions rather than just depending on newer ones.
I can't force everyone to agree but I do think it's nicer to have less dependencies for end-users whenever possible.
Hokay.
After some discussion on their list and digging through source control, it appears that SWIG was updated to support the PHP and Java bindings.
I have no way of testing either of those, but I can say that librets builds correctly with the Ruby bindings under SWIG 1.3.31.
This is *really* foreign territory for me, but I'd be willing to put in a patch that tweaks their config file to allow 1.3.31 if that sounds like the right approach to you guys.
Sounds like a good approach.
Thanks for the legwork, this is foreign territory for everyone at some stage :)
Hokay!
The new commit (8c1ffa4) modifies the librets formula to work with SWIG 1.3.31.
It works great for me...
I've got a few other people trying it but I expect success.
so Lion doesn't seem to ship with swig any more.
Can this go in now?
:D
Pulled.

title: validates_uniqueness_of fails in integration test
body: In researching #2333, I came across a scenario in which a validates_uniqueness_of constraint passes in a unit test, but fails in an integration test.

Run the following to reproduce:

```
gem install rails -v 3.1.0.rc6
rails new example
cd example
rails generate scaffold user email:string
rake db:migrate
rake db:test:prepare
echo "require 'test_helper'

class usertest < Activesupport::testCase
  test 'validates uniqueness of email' do
    user.create!

(:email => 'foo@bar.com')
    assert_raises ActiveRecord::RecordInvalid do
      user.create!

(:email => 'foo@bar.com')
    end
  end
end
" > test/unit/user_test.rb
echo "require 'test_helper'

class userstest < ActionDispatch::Integrationtest
  test 'user validates uniqueness of email' do
    assert_equal 2, user.count, 'expected 2 fixtures'
    post users_path, :email => 'abc@def.com'
    assert_equal 3, user.count, 'expected one more user created'
    post users_path, :email => 'abc@def.com'
    assert_equal 3, user.count, 'expected 2nd user with same email to not be created'
  end
end

" > test/integration/users_test.rb
echo "class user < ActiveRecord::Base
  validates_uniqueness_of :email
end
" > app/models/user.rb
rake test:units test:integration

The `post` should be

```ruby

title: Allow request body to be specified for DELETE requests.
body: The HTTP spec does not explicitly disallow message body content from being specified in DELETE requests, therefor many believe it to be allowed.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/299628/is-an-entity-body-allowed-for-an-http-delete-request

however, RestSharp seems to not support specifying a request body for DELETE requests.

I am trying to use RestSharp to communicate with the TeamCity REST API to 'Pin' and 'Unpin' builds...

http://confluence.jetbrains.com/display/TW/REST+API+Plugin#RESTAPIPlugin-BuildPinning

> Build Pinning
> 
> Get current pin status: GET http://teamcity:8111/httpAuth/app/rest/builds/<buildLocator>/pin/ (returns "true" or "false" text)
> Pin: PUT http://teamcity:8111/httpAuth/app/rest/builds/<buildLocator>/pin/ (the text in the request data is added as a comment for the action)
> Unpin: DELETE http://teamcity:8111/httpAuth/app/rest/builds/<buildLocator>/pin/ (the text in the request data is added as a comment for the action)
> (<buildLocator> here should match a single build only)

When making requests to Pin or Unpin, you need to use PUT and DELETE requests, respectively, to the same URL.
You can optionally Include a comment message in the request body if you specify the "Content-Type: text/plain" header.

here is the PUT:

> PUT http://teamcity.example.com/guestAuth/app/rest/builds/id:12345/pin HTTP/1.1
> Accept: application/json, application/xml, text/json, text/x-json, text/javascript, text/xml
> user-Agent: RestSharp 104.1.0.0
> Content-Type: text/plain
> Host: teamcity.example.com
> Content-Length: 18
> Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
> 
> My comment for Pin

here is the DELETE:

> DELETE http://teamcity.example.com/guestAuth/app/rest/builds/id:12345/pin HTTP/1.1
> Accept: application/json, application/xml, text/json, text/x-json, text/javascript, text/xml
> user-Agent: RestSharp 104.1.0.0
> Host: teamcity.example.com
> Content-Length: 0
> Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate

It seems RestSharp completely drops the specified body and content type.
RestSharp should allow adding a request body to DELETE requests just like all other methods.
Issue #55 was caused by this bug.
It was only closed because the OP -found- a different work-around for what they were trying to do.
I also just -found- a Google Group discussion about this: https://groups.google.com/forum/#!topic/restsharp/IChKmMNWLsg
want to submit a pull request with the proposed change?

What @johnsheehan proposed seems reasonable:

> I think the solution to this is to add ParameterType.Url and 
> ParameterType.Body and -make  SURE- that those are guaranteed to get 
> written to the specified location insteadof depending on the 
> method-specific logic.
Oops, ignore the close/reopen.
I would be happy to make  the proposed change as a PR.
I will try what @johnsheehan proposed, it sounds like a good solution.
Are there any request types that should *not* be allowed to have body content specified?
@jessewebb I'll be honest, I haven't read up on the spec carefully, but it's probably in there.
(M) My guess is `HEAD` and `GET`.
@jessewebb any updates?
@Haacked I should have this done by next week.
I know you are trying to push out a new release, I apologize if this is holding that up.
@jessewebb That'd be great!
It's not holding up this release.
We'll just release again when your fix comes in.

title: fix cropping issue with rotated image using EXIF Orientation tag
body: fix for issue #1028, where cropping such as "50x50#" does not work correctly (it ends up with a wrong size such as 50x21) with a rotated image using EXIF Orientation tag.
Includes tests.
Thanks for your work on this!
We'd be happy to merge this in after you've done a (fairly minor) round of revisions.
Somehow I feel that we should just make  the auto-orient to be the default.
I think that is an expected behavior that people would expect it.
adding another setting there seems ugly to me.
Do you agree, @jyurek?
Anyway, if we change this default, we should bump a minor version.
I agree with @sikachu.
Any proper display of the image will take the orientation into account anyway, and so we should just properly orient the image.
The original, of course, should be unaffected (unless defined otherwise).
I am pretty sure this is setting auto_orient to true by default: check out https://github.com/thoughtbot/paperclip/pull/1048/files#L1R34
Thinking about this more, the correct geometry for a 300x200 image that's orientation 6 isn't "200x300".
(M) It's "300x200 with orientation 6".
I'm going to try modifying the Geometry class to handle this, and the Thumbnail class to take it into consideration.
While I appreciate the code and enthusiasm for fixing the problem, the provided implementation didn't feel right to me.
I've pushed up an implementation that I prefer.
Please try it out and let me know if it doesn't meet your needs.
Thanks again for this code.

title: [DoctrineBridge] Cannot find entities inside Phar files
body: If a Symfony 2 application is packaged inside a Phar file and Doctrine is configured to search for entities inside the Phar archive, the path will not be -found-.
Cannot load Doctrine mapping/bundle named "%s".

', $mappingName));
}
```
`is_dir` will return `true`, while `realpath` will return `false`, causing the application to fail later on with the exception:

```
  [Doctrine\Common\Persistence\Mapping\MappingException]
  File mapping drivers must have a valid directory path, however the given path  seems to be incorrect!
This is a Doctrine issue, could you please re-post it at https://github.com/doctrine/common and close this one?

(M) the issue is in the doctrine bridge when configuring Doctrine, not in Doctrine itself.
see the analysis of the cause of the issue
There is an issue in Doctrine as well in order to get this to work, but I have reported an issue there too (see http://www.doctrine-project.org/jira/browse/DCOM-204)
